Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

When you look at L’Oréal, what do you see? If all you see is lipstick, look again and experience the Freedom to go Beyond the ordinary. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal. We operate in 150 countries on 5 continents. With 36 international brands and 86,000 employees worldwide, we’re well on our way to fulfilling our common purpose: to create beauty that moves the world.

By 2030 we want to capture over another 1 billion consumers around the world. How? By creating cosmetic products which meet the infinite diversity of consumers beauty needs and desires, and always through digital innovation. Not only that, but taking our sustainability goals seriously; moving us to a more inclusive and sustainable society, for every generation.

Our brands, dynamic culture, and always being our own challenger mean that we offer freedom and opportunity you won’t get anywhere else.

If you want the Freedom to go Beyond, we’ll see you at L’Oréal.

Our Corporate Division supports the 4000+ strong workforce in L’Oréal UK & Ireland. It’s a fast-paced and dynamic environment when you’ll have visibility over our 4 Divisions and play an integral role in moving our business forward. The Ecommerce Acceleration Team exists to make L’Oreal UKI a digital first business by 2024 and drive market share across all our brands and divisions.

We embrace our entrepreneurial spirit in everything we do, always challenging ourselves to new ways of doing things. That means looking for innovative solutions, sustainable developments, and having the freedom to go beyond the ordinary.

Our founder Eugène Schueller once said that “a company is not walls and machines, it’s people, people, people”. Joining our corporate teams means joining the world leader in beauty, at the cutting edge of innovation. But above all, it means becoming part of a team of talented and inspiring people.

You will

Define and steer data quality improvement plan for all data regarding A&P and Promo

>define new templates

>Review the improvement roadmap implementation with key stakeholders: data owners within all divisions of the UKI and Global Data PO

Collect and transform Data

>Test, implement and upgrade a Semi-automation process for collection and transformation of our manual A&P data

>Lead the collection of all data regarding A&P management and required for MMMs across the UKI

>Manage and extract in autonomy media data from the Essence Data Platform and other sources:

Define the right extraction parameters
Give feedback to the EDDS via the Global PO

>Give feedback to local providers on corrections that should be applied at sourcing data

Automate Data sourcing

>Upgrade data sourcing and support central data automation

Define local data governance
Identify local data assets per domain (sell out, O+O)
Define owners depending on levers, domains, and tools
Increase data availability and literacy

You have

The ability to make appropriate decisions when supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products
Knowledge of data management and business knowledge – particularly media to be able to translate and apply data driven solutions
The ability to build processes supporting data transformation, data structures and dependency
The ability to coordinate data collection across different teams and sources
Highly numerate, analytically strong and a great eye for detail
Power BI, DAX, Advanced Excel, VBA (essential)
GCP, SQL, Google Cloud Platform, Python (desirable)
Strong organisational skills
Experience of agile project management and strong organizational skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

You are

Demonstrates entrepreneurship
Manages Complexity
Achieves results with integrity
Acts/Leads with human sensitivity
Displays sensitivity to the métier
Interacts effectively
Innovates

You get

We put people development and learning at the heart of our business; we’ll help you master your role, develop your technical expertise and you’ll benefit from exceptional management and leadership programmes. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, you’re actively encouraged to embed learning into your daily life and are rewarded for continuous improvement. Don’t forget that every employee gets 3 Coursera credits; that means you can get qualifications from over 1000 universities from around the world, with thousands of courses to choose from.

Looking for a good work/life balance? With our new hybrid working scheme, you can take a flexible approach to work as well as benefit from early finishes on Fridays during the summer...so you can enjoy more time with your friends and family.

As any great employer should do, we make sure we look after your financial wellbeing. That’s why we have a great pension plan, profit share scheme and many more incentives to give you the security you deserve. We also put employee health and wellbeing at the front of everything we do; fully training employees as mental health ambassadors to support and educate ourselves further. There’s also the chance to enrol in medical and dental insurance, gym discounts, health check-ups and even yoga and Pilates classes to employees in all of our locations.

Oh, did we mention that as an employee you also get discount sales of up to 70% off throughout the year on our 36 brands? Plus, you also get the option to share that in our Friends and Family sales as well!

How we recruit

At L’Oréal, we take pride in creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where everyone is welcome and their contributions are valued. When we recruit, hire, train, promote or engage in any other employment practice, we are committed to being an inclusive employer regardless of race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, socioeconomic status, medical condition or disability, or any other protected status. When we look for talent, we welcome difference - different backgrounds, experiences, personalities and perspectives. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal.

When we look for talent, we welcome difference - different backgrounds, experiences, personalities and perspectives. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
This is a great opportunity for someone interested in data visualisation & web development to use and develop their skills to help tackle climate change. We are looking for candidates with fundamental coding skills and with a strong interest in building interactive and accessible data visualisations.

New AutoMotive is a not-for-profit transport research organisation with a mission to accelerate and support the transition to electric vehicles. We use vehicle data to show consumers how they can benefit from the EV transition and to help shape and influence policy to promote EVs. We are currently developing products that unlock the data to help people plan the transition to electric vehicles - a key part of the UK’s transition to net zero carbon emissions.

Requirements

Duties will include:

Developing tools for consumers to navigate the transition to EVs
Building dashboards and portals for people to access data
Helping process and store data
Facilitating the development of data visualisations and tools to make data accessible to a wider audience
Assisting with the production of digital products
Contributing to the creation of documentation and writing up methodologies
Other duties as required.


Skills and experience:

Essential

Familiarity with a programming language (ideally JavaScript)
Experience in working with large datasets
Willingness to learn


Desirable

Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g. python, SQL, R)
Basic knowledge of Git and GitHub
Scientific background (i.e. maths, physics, statistics)


You’ll be a key part of New AutoMotive’s growing data team, and have the opportunity to get involved with work that helps shape and influence public policy. We’re committed to training & skills - if you want to develop your coding skills then we will support you to do so. No prior professional experience is required, and recent graduates are encouraged to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job title: Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Salary: Up to £50,000 DOE

Contract Type: Permanent

The Role:

Primis Talent are delighted to be working with a leading construction and property consultancy who are looking for brand-new Data Analyst to join their Market and Data Analysis team. The ideal Data Analyst will have experience using Power BI and have excellent PowerPoint skills. The role will be pivotal in implementing and developing to the wider data management strategy concentrating on the Data Collection and Analysis side of their service. This is a fantastic opportunity to make a huge impact on the team and the wider future of the business!




The perfect Data Analyst must have:

A background in the construction/property sector
Experience of Power BI
Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills
Strong data analytical skills
Excellent secondary research skills
Experience of interpreting cost data analytics
Good technical knowledge with ability to review and comment on industry leading reports prepared by others
Ability to think on your own
Excellent time management skills
Great communication skills
Consultancy experience would be a bonus

If this Data Analyst role sounds like the ideal position for you, please email emma.presley@primis-talent.com or get in touch on

+44 (0)203 8543966 .

Alternatively, if you have someone in your network who is the perfect fit for this Data Analyst, let me know! Primis offer a competitive referral scheme for all candidates successfully placed.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




We are looking to recruit a Data Analyst within our Market Data group. The primary focus of this role will be related to the management of inbound and outbound data used to support Tradeweb's electronic trading platform and its data products. In this role, the Data Analyst will be involved with the onboarding and review process related to new and existing reference data used to populate Tradeweb's Security Master Data. The Analyst will also be responsible in documenting and maintaining quality checks on data products. The data will cover a broad array of financial markets and securities.




Job Responsibilities:




Update and document current data processes.
Develop tests, reports, and procedures around data quality improvements.
Perform operational checks for data quality validation.
Implement data requests to fulfill business requirements.
Track and communicate entitlement changes related to use of third party data.
Analyze and test new and existing data sets.
Write specifications around data extraction, transformation, and mapping.
Day-to-day operational work; quality checks, daily tests, internal client queries.




Required Qualifications:




Strong academic record, including a relevant degree (Finance/computer science/technology).
Passion for data analysis with emphasis on financial markets reference data.
Knowledge of Fixed Income and Equity securities across a broad array of markets is a plus.
Strong data analysis skills with an emphasis on data quality.
Familiarity with data mapping, data modeling, and relational database design.
Ability to write basic to intermediate SQL queries.
Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, VBA, database connections, etc.) .
Experience with Python
Strong communication skills and the ability to coordinate projects with multiple parties.
Ability to work on multiple projects with shifting priorities in a fast paced environment.




About Tradeweb:




Tradeweb Markets Inc. (NASDAQ: TW) is a leading, global operator of electronic marketplaces for rates, credit, equities and money markets. Founded in 1996, Tradeweb provides access to markets, data and analytics, electronic trading, straight-through-processing and reporting for clients in the institutional, wholesale and retail markets. Advanced technologies developed by Tradeweb enhance price discovery, order execution and trade workflows while allowing for greater scale and helping to reduce risks in client trading operations. For more information, please go to www.tradeweb.com .




Tradeweb values diversity of culture and thought and seeks talented, qualified employees in all its operations around the world regardless of race, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other protected classification under country or local law.




Private Policy Statement Link:




https://www2.tradeweb.com/l/105492/2021-05-05/h7v2kl/105492/1620231674fqv9j2ci/Tradeweb_EU_Applicant_Privacy_Policy.pdf

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

As Data Analyst with PowerBi Reporting experience, you’ll deliver data/analytical solutions across the complex Heathrow environment. Building strong relationships with other business areas to understand business needs, you’ll develop and deliver data/analytics projects to improve efficiency, quality, service and value. Working with historical data and future forecasts, you’ll use agile principles to manage tasks, analytical requirements, and the build of reporting tools/models. You’ll combine datasets to provide enriched visualisations and analytical solutions.

Your role will involve:

Delivering analytical solutions and Business Intelligence tools such as reports and dashboards
Designing metrics, simplify data querying and visualise insights, maintain data updates
Timely project delivery from inception to deployment, ensuring effective integration of solutions into the operation
Combining datasets to drive meaningful outputs including ad-hoc deep dive analytics and qualitative & quantitative analysis


These skills are essential:

Experience with PowerBi Reporting/DAX is essential. As is experience in Data Visualisation.
Comfortable and confident with data and highly analytical.
Proven track record of delivery using formal analytics tools and techniques
Critical to this role is the ability to problem solve, motivation to make a big impact on our business through simplicity and an ability to work to tight deadlines.
Experience in programming languages (R or Python)


Ideally, you'll also have:

Experience with Power Apps is highly desirable
Expertise in Data Wrangling, Data Storytelling, Machine learning and Data Mining.
Performance reporting, KPI definition, and balanced scorecards
Experience of communicating complex data to analytical and non-analytical audiences
Experience in or desire to learn data modelling, DAX, M Language, Power Platform, VBA
Understanding of the complex airport operation with an appreciation for its interdependencies


About Us

Heathrow brings the world closer together. Our airport facilitates the global travel and trade that keeps the economy moving. It’s a place like no other – a city within a city – where colleagues connect around a common goal, giving our passengers the best airport service in the world.

There is a world of opportunity at Heathrow. You’ll reach your full potential within our inclusive and supportive culture, whilst helping us to deliver our ambitious plans. Not only are we growing to welcome millions more passengers each year, we’re also transforming our industry. Sustainability is at the heart of Heathrow and we’re leading global efforts on decarbonisation, so that aviation continues to be a force for good in our world.

Taking the journey with us means living our values. Doing the right thing. Keeping everyone safe. Working together. Treating everyone with respect. Giving excellent service. Improving every day. Our ever-changing airport runs on teamwork and creativity. A career at Heathrow is welcoming, diverse, challenging, exciting, and rewarding.

Join Heathrow and grow your career in an airport that matters to millions.

Our rewards

We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits, along with performance-based annual bonuses, our longer-term Share in Success Bonus plans, generous annual leave allowances and market-leading pensions. With family friendly policies, access to private health insurance and a wide range of wellbeing tools, we’ll support you to be at your best inside and outside work. And we’ll provide learning and development opportunities to help you reach your full potential.

Working Location

Our agile approach offers the opportunity to combine home working with meetings, events and training at the airport. All roles involve some on-site working each week, so you’ll need to be based in the UK and within a commutable distance to Heathrow.

Sustainable Travel to work

Heathrow’s Sustainable Travel Guide sets out easy and sustainable travel options that everyone can access.

Equal Opportunities As an equal opportunities employer, we encourage applications from all. We believe that diverse talent makes us stronger – not least because we welcome passengers from all corners of the globe, every single day. Heathrow is an accessible place to work. With four diversity networks, we champion inclusivity and celebrate individuality.

Organization

At Heathrow, we’re passionate about making every journey better. That means ensuring we meet the changing needs of the passengers, colleagues and partners who use our airport. Our Solutions team encompasses project management, process improvement, business change, technology, cyber defence and procurement. It brings together the people with the skills to deliver diverse, prestigious and often large-scale projects from start to finish.

You’ll be part of a team that is shaping our airport, and the experience of countless passengers. It’s a collaborative environment, where you can rely on the support of the experts you’ll be working with every day. Whether working on the technology at the bedrock of our organisation, the commercial agreements that our operation relies on, or the infrastructure that we’re transforming every day, you’ll be taking on projects you can take pride in and feel passionate about. It’s an exciting place to be because the scale of what we do is vast. Every day will test your skills and give you the opportunity to make your mark.

Join Solutions and be an incredibly important part of our recovery, as we ramp up and welcome passengers back to the airport.


Show more Show less

Building strong relationships with other business areas to understand business needs, you’ll develop and deliver data/analytics projects to improve efficiency, quality, service and value. Working with historical data and future forecasts, you’ll use agile principles to manage tasks, analytical requirements, and the build of reporting tools/models. You’ll combine datasets to provide enriched visualisations and analytical solutions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📊📈📉 Data Analyst | Global Brand | 50 Million Customers| £50,000 - £60,000 📉📈📊




🌍 Hybrid with offices in London

🏆 Multiple Awards

📈 Steep Learning Curve

✈️ Unlimited holidays




This well-known, hugely successful brand is a unique group of companies that is changing businesses for good, giving customers choice and better service and having fun along the way !




(and I mean a lot of fun) 🏏🎮




They are now on the hunt for a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team of data wizards 🧙




They are a fast growing and an exciting company that rewards innovation and hard work. Their goal is to make a difference in the world and also for the customer through data driven decisions and actions.




The role




If you are Data Analyst that wants more than just building reports to pass on to someone else then this is the next role for you. You would help to lead the way in driving data in a positive direction across all areas of the business , not just building reports but actually owning the insights attached to them !




If you enjoy the discovery phase all the way through to unlocking key insights for a business then this is the next data analyst role for you !

What we need from you :




✔️ Experience analyzing data in a commercial setting

✔️ Strong business acumen , understanding the impact that deriving insights have

✔️ Relevant experience cleaning data in SQL and comfortable in a BI tools such as (Tableau or Power BI)

✔️ Great communication skills and comfortable speaking to technical and non-technical stakeholders




If you feel like working for a brand known all over the globe , want to take on a steep learning curve but also have crazy amounts of fun then this is the next Data Analyst role for you !




Apply now !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:




This full-time contract position offers a hybrid working model with 3 days onsite per week in the Central London Kings Cross offices.




Onsite days are Tuesdays, Wednesdays & Thursdays. Remote days are Mondays & Fridays.




This role is paid on a PAYE basis and you'll be entitled to 33 days paid holiday, inclusive of bank holidays, per annum, pro rata.




There is also a company bonus plan that you could be eligible for.




The Opportunity:




Our client, a multinational technology company, is searching for a Data Analyst to join them for a period of 6 months.




The successful candidate will be tasked with contributing to solutions for straightforward problems and executing the solutions to analytical tasks with guidance from more senior analysts or management. You will also drive analyses that are pertinent to the core business priorities and impact decisions with material user implications and revenue at stake, with some guidance from more senior analysts or management.




In return, you can expect to receive an hourly rate of £25 p/h (52k) PAYE.




Your other responsibilities will include but are not limited to:




Escalating unanticipated issues to management.
Partnering with cross-functional teams within Marketing and the business, to develop deeper context to inform analysis.
Providing input to and collaborating closely with junior and mid-level MA counters to better understand data or products.
Adopting best practices for the organisation, collecting and tracking core metrics, and avoiding duplication of existing work.
Developing expertise with broader awareness of other analytical techniques to understand limitations.




About you:




The successful candidate will have extensive experience in the following:

SQL
Strong presentation skills
A good understanding of data extraction, dashboarding/visualisation, experimental design, statistical analysis, basic predictive modelling, and/or qualitative and quantitative research techniques.
Creation of reports, and the ability to present these to senior stakeholders







** Please note, if you have not received a response within 48 working hours, your application has been unsuccessful at this time**




Client Description:

Our Client is a multinational technology company, specialising in Internet-related services and products; including online advertising technologies, search engine, cloud computing, software, and hardware. The atmosphere is relaxed with a diverse and innovative culture. Opportunities for growth and progression and networking with like-minded people across the business and beyond.




Aquent is dedicated to improving inclusivity & is proudly an equal opportunities employer. We encourage applications from under-represented groups & are committed to providing support to applicants with disabilities. We aim to provide reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, to those with a medical condition, disability or neurodivergence.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (SPSS)
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – Permanent




Salary: £35,000-£45,000




Location: Central London




Are you a passionate Data enthusiast looking for the next significant step in your career? Do you have experience working with SPSS, Stata, SAS or Python?




The client




Working on important and impactful public policy challenges, such as improving girls' access to education to transforming citizen experience of public services.







Your responsibilities




Able to coordinate and manage multiple projects in a team environment
Checking of supplied data for sense, consistency and accuracy.
Understanding, articulating, managing and responding to customer's detailed technical issues in a timely manner
Ability to complete detailed work accurately







Your experience




Ideally an interest to work in research/public policy
Experience in data administration, data analysis, data warehousing and data cleaning
Experience using Python, SPSS and Excel
Competent in Windows based setting, proficient in keyboarding, internet, and automated systems usage
An understanding of relational, object and dimensional databases
Ability to build relationships with clients with strong interpersonal and communication skills










What’s next?




If you believe you have the desired skills and experience, please follow the link to apply and attach a copy of your latest CV. If successful, a Consultant will be in touch to discuss in more detail.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

Job Description

About the role

Verisk Maplecroft’s datasets are the core of the company’s offering and your numeracy skills, attention to detail, commercial awareness and project management skills will ensure that the datasets are delivered on time to clients with the highest level of accuracy. You will be creative and draw on your domain knowledge to develop new datasets and write analytical content for data clients. As someone with strong quantitative skills, you will support colleagues in the wider Research and Consulting teams with client work and support the Sales team in helping clients to understand and use the company’s data. You will be based in Bath, Edinburgh or London and report to the Head of Country Risk Data.

About The Day-to-day Responsibilities Of The Role

Support updates to the company’s thematic datasets.
Improving these datasets by listening to client feedback, finding new data sources, and implementing new scoring methodologies.
Managing a project plan to ensure timely delivery of updates.
Supporting colleagues and clients with questions on these datasets in collaboration with the wider Analytics team.
Writing occasional data-rich insights to show the value of the data.
Using your quantitative skills to help colleagues in Consulting deliver projects on time, on budget, that meet the clients’ needs.

Qualifications

Degree level (or equivalent) qualification in a subject with a quantitative element (required)
Advanced Excel skills (required)
1+ years of work experience in a quantitative role (required)
Excellent organisational skills and ability to work in a team (required)
Domain knowledge (post graduate degree or equivalent experience) in one of the following human rights, politics, environmental or climate science, economics, or commodities (preferred)

Additional Information

In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.

For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.

Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.

Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.

Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other
Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes
Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

http://www.verisk.com/careers.html

Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – ETL, Power BI, Azure Data Factory – London with Hybrid working

Up to £40k base with fantastic benefits




We are working with a particularly lovely organisation based in north London who are looking for 2 talented Data Analysts to join a great team delivering business critical data focus for the overall organisation.




This specific team deliver data ETL, reporting, insight and emerging machine learning models for business-critical decision making across a very interesting division of the organisation.




This role is responsible for producing meaningful insight, enabling the organisation to be data-driven through the delivery of analytics and business intelligence solutions. The role also works closely with colleagues across the Operations Division to increase their data fluency and ability to determine which decisions need taking.




The person in this role will also work closely with our Data Community of practice, as we complete our transition from old to new data platforms.




What you will be doing….

Proactively understand business processes and collaborate with business users to identify analytic opportunities.
Deliver actionable business insights through data analysis, visualization and storytelling, and deploy business intelligence solutions that enable business users to self-serve.
Produce, document and maintain the data flows that enable best in class analyses using data from various sources.
Assist with training and developing colleagues in the use of business reporting and interpreting the data provided.
Adhere to our established validation and governance standards, working with data colleagues to validate each other’s work.
Uphold the highest standard of data quality across our data pipelines and where possible, automate the process.
Collaborate with colleagues in the Data Community and proactively contribute to the delivery of the organisational Data Strategy




What we are looking for…

Experience in building models for MS Power BI (or similar visualization tools) and creating meaningful stories with visualisations
Significant experience in the principles of ETL and confidence in design data models that blend data from various sources. We currently use Azure Data Factory, Data Studio and Power BI, having recently shifted from Alteryx and Tableau.
Understanding of the principles and use of coding languages: we currently use tSQL, DAX, Python and Data Mapping Flows Expression language
Relevant experience in managing self and working with teams to derive actionable insight from concept to delivery, through data analysis, reporting and visualization.
The ability to train and support business colleagues with data literacy, and the skills to clearly and concisely communicate both verbally and in writing.
Excellent attention to detail and the user experience of data products
Experience in applying critical thinking for problem framing and some experience of business process mapping.




This role will offer the chance to start learning more about machine learning for the right candidate.




In return there is a competitive starting salary coupled with a fantastic range of benefits and very flexible hybrid working. This is a truly lovely organisation with a great culture and scope for growth and training. Please get in touch to have an informal chat about the role.

Show more Show less
HTML:
Data Analyst – ETL, Power BI, Azure Data Factory – London with Hybrid working

Up to £40k base with fantastic benefits


We are working with a particularly lovely organisation based in north London who are looking for 2 talented Data Analysts to join a great team delivering business critical data focus for the overall organisation.


This specific team deliver data ETL, reporting, insight and emerging machine learning models for business-critical decision making across a very interesting division of the organisation.


This role is responsible for producing meaningful insight, enabling the organisation to be data-driven through the delivery of analytics and business intelligence solutions. The role also works closely with colleagues across the Operations Division to increase their data fluency and ability to determine which decisions need taking.


The person in this role will also work closely with our Data Community of practice, as we complete our transition from old to new data platforms.


What you will be doing….

  • Proactively understand business processes and collaborate with business users to identify analytic opportunities.
  • Deliver actionable business insights through data analysis, visualization and storytelling, and deploy business intelligence solutions that enable business users to self-serve.
  • Produce, document and maintain the data flows that enable best in class analyses using data from various sources.
  • Assist with training and developing colleagues in the use of business reporting and interpreting the data provided.
  • Adhere to our established validation and governance standards, working with data colleagues to validate each other’s work.
  • Uphold the highest standard of data quality across our data pipelines and where possible, automate the process.
  • Collaborate with colleagues in the Data Community and proactively contribute to the delivery of the organisational Data Strategy


What we are looking for…

  • Experience in building models for MS Power BI (or similar visualization tools) and creating meaningful stories with visualisations
  • Significant experience in the principles of ETL and confidence in design data models that blend data from various sources. We currently use Azure Data Factory, Data Studio and Power BI, having recently shifted from Alteryx and Tableau.
  • Understanding of the principles and use of coding languages: we currently use tSQL, DAX, Python and Data Mapping Flows Expression language
  • Relevant experience in managing self and working with teams to derive actionable insight from concept to delivery, through data analysis, reporting and visualization.
  • The ability to train and support business colleagues with data literacy, and the skills to clearly and concisely communicate both verbally and in writing.
  • Excellent attention to detail and the user experience of data products
  • Experience in applying critical thinking for problem framing and some experience of business process mapping.


This role will offer the chance to start learning more about machine learning for the right candidate.


In return there is a competitive starting salary coupled with a fantastic range of benefits and very flexible hybrid working. This is a truly lovely organisation with a great culture and scope for growth and training. Please get in touch to have an informal chat about the role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client, a Technology and marketing company who aim to build and maintain online client platforms such as websites, web apps and mobile, are looking for a data analyst to join the ever growing team. If you're passionate about data and how it can help improve a company through visual information then this may be the role for you.




This position is office based with options for remote work. This is truly a great place to work highlighted through a very attractive benefits package. This opportunity offers the chance to work in their custom designed offices with incredible amenities for staff, not something you want to miss.




The Role




A data analyst will be responsible for maintaining their data environments, analysing rows of data and visualise the findings. Your job will be to use data to report to the business to allow them to improve.




Responsibilities




Use Python, SQL and Tableau on a daily basis to analyse millions of rows of data and visualise the findings
Understanding and extensive knowledge of customer behaviour
Perform deep dive analytics across the business working in an advanced analytics function
To provide dashboards, analysis and reports




The Ideal Candidate Will




Degree level ideally in Maths/Stats/Engineering/Information systems
Passionate about data
Experience in SQL and Python
Excellent maths skills
Experience in Dashboard visualisation
Knowledge in how to analyse large amounts of data quickly
Experience in providing data insights
Experience in analysing customer behaviour




Benefits




My client promotes a great atmosphere, described as a great place to work. They are a medium sized company with huge investment. They listen to their employees, allowing you to make a great impact on your everyday life. With a personal chef and a games room the office creates a great buzz. Option to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays, free parking or a short walk from the station, with a free gym membership the benefits are huge.




If interested please contact George Eastman at Catchfish.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Reference #




266430BR




Job Type




Full Time




Your role




Are you eager to help drive a culture of continuous learning and improvement? Do you have a curious nature, and do you enjoy technology and engineering? Are you organized?




Working for the CDIO Transformation Office, we are looking for a Data Analyst to help us:





maintain and upgrade our data dashboards and reports, gathering data from diverse sources including through APIs
identify opportunities to improve, simplify and automate our processes and analytics
collect and organize information for monitoring and reviews within the Certified Engineers program
leverage technologies to support our engineering excellence initiatives
engage with colleagues at all levels to meet business requirements
provide general administrative support to the team





Your team




You will be working for the CDIO Transformation Office, focusing on the Distinguished Engineers framework, Certified Engineers program, and additional engineering excellence initiatives. You will have the opportunity to collaborate and network with engineers from across CDIO functions and regions. As an analyst, you will play a key role in supporting culture change in CDIO.




Your expertise





a university degree in an analytical field, such as engineering, computer science/ information technology or finance
hands-on experience with data analysis and data visualization
a background and understanding of common reporting tools and disciplines (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI)
strong analytical, problem-solving, and synthesizing skills
Programming skills (e.g. Python)
awareness of user experience and design principles
a proactive, detail-oriented, and methodical approach to your work
motivation and the ability to work independently and apply own initiative
strong communication skills
fluency in English





About Us




UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.




With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?




How We Hire




This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html




Join us




At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.




From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?




Disclaimer / Policy Statements




UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst



Data Idols are proud to be working with a consumer research platform that partner with global brands. Their goal is to give clients a simple life by allowing them to run regular research and achieve structured, clear insights to reveal opportunities with consumer data.





The Opportunity



As a Data Analyst, you will be working alongside a Data Analyst and will be on a mission to extract raw data using Excel to create analysis for the specified client. The selected Data Analyst will also be running research surveys and collecting data to provide useful insights. You will be able to develop your skills over the period and network within the data community.





Skills and Experience


Excel
SQL
Desirable: Q Research Software


What's in it for you?


£200-300 per day
Fully remote

Please send your CV in for initial screening.





Data Analyst

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a recent numerical graduate looking to build on your foundation experience and take the next step to become a data analyst? Do you have a passion for using data to solve problems?




If so, we would like to hear from you; we are a fintech start-up offering a rare development environment working closely with an experienced senior management team.




Opportunity




Reporting directly to the co-founders, you will join an entrepreneurial team in a driven, fast-paced environment. This role is a newly created role responsible for supporting the development and further build-out of our platform integrations which are used to acquire, clean and analyse investment data from a range of UK wealth platforms.




We can offer a challenging and constantly evolving career where you will have an impact and develop new skills and knowledge in software development or data analysis.




About The Role




We offer first-hand experience in obtaining, cleaning, transforming and analysing complex investment data with exposure to various wealth managers and other major financial services clients.




The role will include the following:




Monitoring daily data feeds and handling related data processing tasks
Supporting other developers to add new data feeds and build out API connections
Supporting design, implementation and testing of complex analysis and tax calculations
Attendance at client meetings, pitches and dealing with follow-up
Researching relevant technical issues (e.g. data processing technical solutions, new third-party API specifications and tax or performance analysis-related research)
Assisting with special projects





Additional Information




The position is based in our Soho office.




Salary & Benefits




Basic salary: c.£30,000, increasing with progression
Holiday 20 days, increasing with longevity
Axa Private Health
Pension
Discretionary Bonuses
Training / Exam support





Essential Criteria




Recently graduated or demonstrate 1-2 years of relevant experience
Strong analytical skills.
Background with mathematical and/or computer science skills will be an advantage.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python (in particular Pandas)
Unrestricted rights to work in the UK





Desirable Criteria




Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven team player who is happy to adapt to a wide range of roles and deal with clients, third-party developers, platforms and service providers;
Self-starter and able to stay focused and make decisions within the role profile while working towards tight deadlines
Independent/flexible problem-solver with the ability to cope positively with change
Familiarity with AWS an advantage





About The Company




Confidante is a start-up fintech that aims to revolutionise data integration, analysis and tax reporting for high-net-worth clients of wealth managers and accountants by simplifying workflow and reporting.




We are a former Barclays senior leadership team offering a cloud-hosted application which obtains, cleans and conforms data from a wide range of third-party financial institutions and provides wealth managers with consolidated performance, analysis and tax reporting.




Please view our website for more information about our company and philosophy.




Keywords: Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Analytics Manager, Business Intelligence Analyst, Operations Analyst, Research Analyst and Data Manager,




NO AGENCIES PLEASE




We are using Recruitment Rebellion to run and organise the response for this advert. Please do not contact us if you are a recruiter.




Candidates, please do not apply directly to us, as there is a chance your application will be missed if it does not go through the right channel.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
PM Dragonfly is a fun, friendly and dynamic environment to work in, where you can work on multiple projects at the same time.

The ideal candidate is self-motivated, creative, committed to developing innovative solutions and able to work easily and collaboratively with others. As a data analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for the development and delivery of big data platforms to optimize media spending and solve business problems.




You will be managing, analysing, and organizing data in a variety of ways to provide actionable suggestions or solutions based on that data. Providing the team with direction and guidance in the specific data modelling, data dictionary and data quality of the different platforms being integrated into the Google Cloud ecosystem, primarily using BigQuery as the main data warehouse.

The role offers an excellent opportunity to work on a wide variety of GMP/GCP technologies and business industries. You will have a natural curiosity and a desire to learn. You will develop domain expertise for the clients you will be working on and contribute to our growth culture by sharing relevant knowledge and thinking to optimize client solutions and outcomes.

Key Responsibilities

● Conduct analysis of large data sets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that can be used to improve marketing campaigns, through the use of regression analysis, cohort analysis, cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, time series analysis, etc.

● Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and analyze data from a variety of marketing platform sources (GA, DV360, SA360, CM, Facebook, Amazon, etc) into Google BigQuery, primarily focusing on marketing activities at local, national and global levels.

● Develop, implement and maintain BigQuery databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality

● Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data. Ensuring that the data sets are of correct coverage, completeness and cleanliness.

● Prepare data for numerical and categorical analysis, resolving missing and inconsistent data that may affect the analysis.

● Using statistical methods, tools and modelling techniques to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets

● Preparing clean, visually compelling dashboards and reports for management to easily understand trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data

● Perform ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions, utilising the correct tools for the size of the job

● Understand and comply with data privacy and security policies

● Experience with data-driven attribution modelling, in particular multi-touch attribution models. Proprietary and Confidential. Not for Redistribution.

● Proactively identify opportunities for improvement in both processes and technology

● Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies

● Stay up-to-date on the latest analytical methods and tools and share knowledge with team members

● Mentor junior analysts and help them grow their skills

● Collaborating with training leads on developing training materials




Required Experience & Skills

● Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related field

● 2+ years of experience working with data

● Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

● Attention to detail and accuracy

● Excellent communication and presentation skills

● Knowledge of programming languages SQL, R, MATLAB, and Python

● Technical proficiency in database design, data models, and techniques for data mining and segmentation

● Experience within GCP is essential (BigQuery, BigQueryML, AutoML, Looker Studio and DataPrep/DataFlow)

● Experience with Jupyter Notebooks

● Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, and SAS to be used for data set analyzing

● Demonstrable experience working with data from different API sources –

Previous experience utilising GMP data is preferred (GA4, DV360, CM, SA360, Ads Data Hub) ● Experience working with low-code/no-code data pipeline software such as Fivetran and Data Fusion

● Familiarity with statistical analysis and machine learning

● Understanding of statistical patterns such as Mean & Median, percentiles, standard deviation, etc

● Practical experience with customer segmentation, behaviour analysis and personalization systems

● Strategic thinking and doing. Great written and verbal communication and the ability to work closely with senior stakeholders

Please contact Alison Smith for further details

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: West End, London (hybrid working)

Salary: £40000 - £50000 depending on experience

Bonus: 20-30% of salary




Company: Global FinTech SaaS company that works with private equity / credit and real estate investors. They provide data science that provides insights into client’s portfolios. Investors make important decisions and produce significant returns based on the data from the platform.




Job role: The Data Analyst will provide financial analytics to support clients, including significant focus on financial modelling / statistical analysis for alternative investors & financial services companies, as well as supporting on-going performance reporting and monitoring.




Responsibilities:




Performance Analysis

· Development of Asset Management analytics across many geographies and asset types

· Maintenance and on-going development of models used to analyse performance, refine key assumptions, re-forecast cash flows and update valuations

· Monitor and analyse credit and service performance of portfolio investments, including forecasts and key covenants tests

· Deliver analytics to support optimisation of performance, aimed at improving returns as well as managing risks

· Monitor and assist in the preparation of internal / investor reports

Investment Analysis and Transactional Support

· Build financial models to assess the value and review risk of potential investments, incorporating asset-based cash flow and credit risk analysis

· Prepare investment analysis, including asset level analysis and risk-based simulations for presentation to internal / external constituents

· Assist in broader market research and source external benchmark data

Experience:

· Experience working in the analytics function of a data driven company preferably within the financial services sector.

· Experience using R and Python to interrogate large datasets and undertake complex behavioural analysis.

· Hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing statistical models to predict consumer behaviour.

· Numerical degree, preferably at a Masters level (i.e. mathematics, science, engineering or economics). Batchelor’s degree will be considered.

· Development and improvement of data to support continuous evolution of a more competitive analysis

· Data modelling, profiling and cleansing techniques.

· Experience translating data from multiple sources (from different countries/language) and map them to UK standardised data

Desirable:

· Familiarity with Microsoft technology stack, including data integration, collaboration and business Intelligence tools and their underlying technologies (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, SharePoint, Visual Studio and TFS).

· Monitor and assist in the preparation of internal / investor reports

Investment Analysis and Transactional Support

· Build financial models to assess the value and review risk of potential investments, incorporating asset-based cash flow and credit risk analysis

· Prepare investment analysis, including asset level analysis and risk-based simulations for presentation to internal / external constituents

· Assist in broader market research and source external benchmark data

Experience:

· Experience working in the analytics function of a data driven company preferably within the financial services sector.

· Experience using R and Python to interrogate large datasets and undertake complex behavioural analysis.

· Hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing statistical models to predict consumer behaviour.

· Numerical degree, preferably at a Masters level (i.e. mathematics, science, engineering or economics). Batchelor’s degree will be considered.

· Development and improvement of data to support continuous evolution of a more competitive analysis

· Data modelling, profiling and cleansing techniques.

· Experience translating data from multiple sources (from different countries/language) and map them to UK standardised data

Desirable:

· Familiarity with Microsoft technology stack, including data integration, collaboration and business Intelligence tools and their underlying technologies (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, SharePoint, Visual Studio and TFS).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst- Ecommerce ( Python/ SQL) Hybrid ( 2-3 days in London office)




A well recognized leading B2B/B2C company based in London. The BI team covers data analysis and insights holistically from advanced analytics to data modelling and state-of-the-art data visualization in order to generate strategic insights that support and drive the business. You will have the chance to work with a fantastic team working in a fun and engaging work environment!

As the Data Analyst you will be responsible for:




Developing actionable insight and communicating key learnings to global business stakeholders
Perform data maintenance, data processes reviews, and data quality checks across CRM systems (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud) and external data source platforms
Develop and maintain business projection models to inform senior stakeholders
Review existing data journeys and data integrity across platforms (Salesforce, Marketing Cloud)
Maintain and support the creation of new data sources and data visualizations (Tableau)
Support the team with regular data transfers and uploads when required
Promote data-informed decision making across key business stakeholders



As the Data Analyst you will have the following experience:




3 years+ as a Data Analyst
Business analytics background
Python/Data Warehouse experience.
Knowledge of SQL and/or SOQL
Experience using Tableau (preferably or similar)
Work experience in CRM marketing or data management is preferable
Strong working Excel knowledge



We are offering flexible working, great package+ benefits. For more information please contact infoAT Freshtechit.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are

Cashplus is a leading UK challenger bank for small businesses. We offer faster, smarter, simpler current accounts for the entrepreneurs, independent businesses and consumers that power the UK economy, yet are too often overlooked by high street banks. Since 2005, we’ve created easier ways for more than 1.6m customers to pay, bank and borrow through our user-friendly digital platform. We understand what our customers need – time and money to run their businesses and live their lives – and our secure, innovative products are designed to help, where others can’t or won’t. A true fintech pioneer, we are a fast-growing and credible UK challenger bank.




http://www.cashplus.com/







Our Values & Behaviours

Cashplus puts the fair treatment of customers at the heart of our business model. Our business goals are:

1. Becoming a bank that customers love

2. Developing brilliant, sustainable products

3. Earning an outstanding reputation




Cashplus values are:

· We innovate with purpose

· We are upfront

· We do it right

· We are all in







The Role

The Data Quality Analyst role provides a vital role in ensuring that the organisation maintains control over data quality.




Working within the Chief Data Officer’s data team the role will working with stakeholders to develop data quality requirements and build the frameworks and controls to ensure they are implemented.




In our data driven and heavily regulated organisation, you’ll monitor enhance data at Cashplus through continuous improvement to its quality, this will drive confidence in business decisions, improve customer experience and assist in ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements relating to data.




Working here

If you enjoy being collaborative, hands-on and have an entrepreneurial spirit you’ll love it here. We’re offering the excitement, scope and stimulation of an innovative fintech with the security of joining an established, sustainable and profitable business.




We are very proud to offer one of the most flexible hybrid working arrangements in the industry!

The expectation for this role will involve a minimum of one day each month - working out of our London Bridge office.




Key Accountabilities

Delivery of business requirements

• Defining and reporting data quality metrics

• Performing data quality audits to find inconsistent data, incomplete data, rule violations

• Identifying root causes of data quality issues; develop recommendations for addressing data quality issues and ensuring the data quality issues are addressed in a timely manner

• Tracking data quality issues, resolutions, and consistently publish their status to stakeholders

• Understanding data lineage and work with Data Owners to document metadata, controls, and business definitions

• Establishing and enhancing processes and standards to improve data governance and data quality across the organisation

• Working with stakeholders to catalogue, prioritise and certify Critical Data Elements

• Identifying and resolve any gaps in implementation of data retention policies

• Support maintenance and audit activity relating to regulatory requirements for data management

• Owner of the Single Customer View processing, working with external parties to ensure effective deployment, data quality and usage as well as ensuring FSCS requirement are met

• Developing excellent working relationship across data science, analytics, development and business stakeholders to build data governance and resolve data questions / issues

You’ll need to have

Essential Skills:

• Experience of writing SQL code to perform data analysis.

• Demonstrated passion for finding and resolving problems.

• Ability to analyse systems and code to understand data lineage through systems.

• Understanding of relational database systems.

• Experience of data analysis and data mapping.

• Excellent written & verbal communication skills.

• Ability to deliver in a fast-moving environment with changing priorities.

• Effective team working.




Desirable skills:

• Beneficial financial services experience in consumer and commercial banking

• Payment schemes and processing.

• Microsoft SQL Server and analytical stack




In return you'll enjoy

· Competitive basic salary

· 7.5% of salary in cash allowing you the flexibility to decide your own benefits (or simply take the cash)

· Share Option Scheme

· 26 days’ holiday increasing each year of service to 33 days

· Ability to buy and sell a further 5 days holiday each year

· 4 x Life Assurance

· Pension salary sacrifice

· Family friendly policies

· Regular social activities and team events

· Charity Volunteering Day




Cashplus is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Quality Analyst | London | Hybrid | £40,000 - £45,000 + 15% bonus

Are you looking to take the next step in your career as a Data Analyst?

Do you want to join an established and expanding pharmaceutical distribution company, serving patients globally to ensure they’re receiving the medicines they require?

Do you want to be a part of an organisation that is working on greenfield projects?




What you’ll be doing:

💥 You’ll be joining a newly formed data governance team – a chance to grow into this role and make it your own

💥 Supporting the business with their data quality – identifying the gaps and providing solutions

💥 Working closely with the Data Quality Manager & stakeholders to promote best practices & recommendations




What you’ll need:

✅ 2-3 years’ commercial experience as a data quality analyst / data analyst

✅ Hands on experience working with SQL & data viz tools (e.g Power BI)

✅ Understanding of data quality & best practices

✅ Experience with Alteryx or equivalent is a plus!




What to expect in return:

⚡️ Flexible hybrid working model – 2 days a week to the London office

⚡️ Learning & development – you’ll have time spent during the week for upskilling

⚡️ A base salary ranging from £40,000 - £45,000 + 15% bonus

⚡️ Juicy benefits like 27 days holidays + 4.5% pension match




Next steps:

Hit apply and we’ll be in touch to go through your experience and discuss the opportunity & client in more detail with you.

As an employer and service provider, we are committed to Equity, Equality, Diversity and Inclusion. Please feel comfortable to let us know if you have a difference or disability that would require us or our clients to make any helpful adjustments for you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Function:

Business Intelligence and Data Science

Closing Date:

27/01/2023

The Fault Analytics and Solutions team is a key component in providing a best-in-class experience for our customers, this is achieved through the development, maintenance & continuous improvements of various data products.

The team have exciting plans for 2022 and beyond, analysing fault data to enable us to create new data products and solutions to our people and customers. We won’t stop innovating and achieving things previously thought not possible through the use of Google Cloud technology.

We need somebody to help us transform the way we handle faults in VMO2 with a proven track record of analysing fault data and good understanding of getting to root cause.

Who we are

At Virgin Media O2 we're going All In, to remove bias and barriers for our people and our candidates. We're working hard to achieve bold ambitions, to help us better represent the diverse communities it serves across the UK. As an equal opportunities employer, we support and encourage you to be your authentic self throughout your application journey.

You will be responsible for:

Maintain and troubleshoot existing in-life data products using management tools such as DBT & Github
Proactively explore complex data using Bigquery, providing meaningful & simple outputs
Provide fault data, analysis and insight to business stakeholders and improvement focussed teams where required
Test hypotheses and learn key insights to improve fault diagnostic processes and inform the business of unidentified issues
Create and maintain dashboards using tools such as Looker for easy-to-understand snapshots of key performance indicators
Support the creation of new data products that deliver increased value to the business
Support wider fault analytics team with in-flight projects and stakeholder requests
Take responsibility for improving the quality of your own and the team’s output, through keeping up to date with latest technology, techniques and methods – and sharing back to the team


The must haves

In order to be considered, you must have the following experience;

Highly competent in merging, managing, interrogating, and extracting data to supply tailored outputs - Advanced SQL skills essential
Curious and enthusiastic about using data to solve problems and engages others to see the benefit of your work
Clear and coherent in communication, both verbal and written, to understand data needs and report results
Able to visualise and present data with clarity, particularly for less technical audiences
Awareness of DataOps, DevOps or Agile methodologies within digital product development
A keen eye for detail and the ability to ask questions to determine key information. Not afraid to question or challenge senior figures to get to the heart of the matter


The other stuff we're looking for

We'd also love you to bring;

Google BigQuery experience
Google Looker
Experience using collaboration tools such as GitHub, Jira & Confluence
Experience and technical understanding of VMO2 specific network & products


What's in it for you?

We know that benefits mean so much more than the 'stuff' we can give you, so we offer a wide range of support, rewards and tools - all focused on helping you to prioritise what really matters.

All work and no play just isn't our style! We're already planning our future ways of working, for when life becomes a little more normal again. We're constantly evolving our approach to enable you to find a great work life balance.

Want to learn more about our benefits? You can check them out here.

Next steps

If we feel like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a two stage interview process.

When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you. Thanks for your patience in the meantime and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media O2 family.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
THE BUSINESS




Illuma is an independent contextual ad-tech company which runs proprietary machine-learning tools to provide clients with intelligent and privacy-friendly way to scale their most valuable audiences online.




We are at an exciting stage in our journey, having just received Series A funding, and we are now investing in our team as we set our sights on global expansion.




At Illuma we are curious, innovative and progressive, committed to seeking new, intelligent solutions to business problems. You will be working with and learning from some of the brightest minds in AI, tech and data science, and you won’t be just a cog in a wheel, you will have an active voice with the opportunity to make real impact and grow your career with us as we scale.




Our technology has been developed by leading academics in data science and artificial intelligence, combined with input from senior advertising and publishing professionals. Our core clients are premium publishers, specialist media buyers and major programmatic advertisers including Microsoft, American Express, TUI, Aviva and Pernod Ricard. Our work was been recognised in The Guardian’s Publishing Trends Report 2019 and by the Digiday Media Awards Europe 2020, where we were finalists for ‘Best Social Good Campaign’.




We differentiate in a cluttered technology sector by challenging most of the norms of mainstream data-driven advertising: instead using AI to work reactively in real-time; re-thinking relevance and expanding success.




Requirements




We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst to work within our technical team, helping to drive efficiency through innovative solutions. Technology is central to our continued growth, and you will be supported by and work alongside other engineers. Moreover, as illuma focuses on digital advertising, and you will be exposed to the industry domain knowledge and will have the opportunity to develop your career path towards technical account manager.




This is a fantastic opportunity to work in a truly dynamic company under inspiring leadership, where you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most exciting technologies in the sector and support the account managing team and sales team.




On a day-to-day basis, you will be responsible for and take the lead on a number of projects where you will use your analytical skills to understand the given brief and foresee any technical challenges that may arise. Alongside others, you will be responsible for data retrieval and analysis, campaign management, and advertising platform support.




Key Responsibilities And Accountabilities




Using a combined knowledge of computer science and applications, modelling statistics, analytics and maths to solve problems
Using data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Performing statistical analysis of data from multiple angles, looking for trends and insights that highlight problems or opportunities
Preparing reports and presenting these to management or clients
Monitoring metrics and developing ways to improve campaign performance
Assisting trading desk platform setup and troubleshoot
Understanding legacy code and executing programmes
Brainstorming for new ideas and technologies to improve development delivery
Continually updating technical and domain knowledge and skills
Following all best practices and procedures as established by the company




Knowledge, Skills And Experience




2:1 degree or higher in Data Science, Statistics, Maths, Operational Research or related area of study
Excellent written and spoken English
Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL) for data retrieval
Proficiency in Python-Statistical Programming or R (especially packages/libraries for data science & analysis)
Experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Microsoft PowerBI, Metabase, Tableau, etc)
Experience with Linux infrastructures & shell scripting
Knowledge & experience of machine learning, and data visualisation are preferable
Knowledge & experience with digital advertising (e.g. demand-side platforms, sell-side platforms, Ad exchanges, etc) are preferable
Up-to-date on latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potential clearly and confidently




You Are




Communication - able to get one's message understood clearly by adopting a range of styles, tools and techniques appropriate to the audience and the nature of the information.




Team working - enthusiastic about helping to build and maintain effective working relationships, working cooperatively with others to be part of a team and lead a team.




Strategic thinking - capable of identifying a vision along with the plans that need to be implemented to meet the end goal. You evaluate situations, decisions, issues, etc. in the short, medium and longer-term.




Analytical Thinking - able to simplify complex problems or projects into component parts, exploring and evaluating them systematically, and identifying and resolving problems.




Planning and organising - capable of prioritising and planning activities taking into account all the relevant issues and factors such as deadlines, resources, with line manager guidance at the outset as required.




Flexibility – able to adapt and work effectively with a variety of situations, individuals or groups. Able to understand and appreciate different and opposing perspectives on an issue, to adapt an approach as the requirements of a situation change




Details




This role will be based at our London office in Farringdon.




Benefits




25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Private medical insurance
Half price gym memberships
Pension
Team socials, stocked fridge, snacks - fun
We operate a Hybrid working model with initially the opportunity to work remotely for up to one day per week increasing to two days after successful completion of the probation period.




Equal Opportunity Statement




We embrace diversity fully and promote an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us.




We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.




Our Values




United Driven Focused Innovative
