Title: Data analyst
Description:
We’re looking for a data analyst to join us here at GWI. Not just any data analyst though. Someone ambitious and genuine, who works best in the midst of a collaborative and forward-thinking team. That’s because as a GWIer you’ll be immersed in the fast-moving world of data tech. We think big to make an impact, we’re not afraid to ask why, and we always show respect. Those values are what got us where we are today, and they’re a big part of what we’re looking for in you.

About The Job

Our newly formed Business Data & Analytics department is on a journey to empower every area of the business with quality data, insights, automated efficiencies and analytics. Our goal is to enhance business performance and to give every GWIer the opportunity to make the best, timely decisions to move at the pace that makes GWI special. GWI is a data company where we power insights for some of the biggest global businesses, but the BD&A team is all about looking inwards and unlocking huge opportunities to work cross-functionally across departments to power up our internal teams with internal data.

We are hiring an experienced data analyst to support the build of our new data and analytics platform as well as varied projects and initiatives across the business. You should be able to extract, integrate and blend data and look for trends and patterns for both system needs and business analysis needs. You will have experience in setting up data management processes, establishing standards and building data models, through to profiling and analysing data in any system, internal or 3rd party, including data lakes and data warehouses. You will be comfortable working with metadata, data lineage and master data and confidently be able to advise the business on these areas.

What You’ll Be Doing

Learn and understand how the data works and be ready to answer questions of the data
Take ownership of data management, data dictionaries and setting standards on data
Document data, data flows, processes and data models
Analyse and document system data for integration into Data Lake and Data Warehouse
Collaborate with Enterprise Data Architect, business experts, and analysts to integrate systems and automate data collection processes
Work with data ingestion pipelines built by Data Engineers and be hands on to support data issues or questions raised on data
Problem solve issues through deep-dive data investigation and present back your findings
Be an advocate for data quality
Setup proactive monitoring of data to support either data quality or timely insights for departmental action
Produce MI and dashboards which help users understand key pressure points in data or processes
Support data testing activities across business and technical areas
Ensure data is available in a fit-for-purpose and timely manner for business and analytics consumption


About You

First things first, as a disruptor in the global market research industry, we haven’t come this far without entrepreneurial spirit and a get-up-and-go attitude. You are joining a small team at the early stages of our greenfield journey. We are looking for someone who is ready and willing to roll sleeves up and get stuck into setting up our data management capabilities. You will have experience with the journey to build up a modern data framework and with your drive and innovation you are ready to deliver data management and data quality for the business. So if you think we’ll see that in you, then you’re already halfway there. Here’s the rest of what we’d like you to bring to the table.

Technical

Highly proficient in SQL and able to write complex queries utilising CTEs and Window functions
Data manipulation and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise and analyse large amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience in data reconciliation against any systems, data platform or BI reporting sources
Experience in designing and implementing workflows for management of data to support business areas as well as the BD&A team
Highly proficient in Excel and/or Google Sheets
Experience with Tableau highly desirable
Experience with Python highly desirable
Preferable experience with GCP and the GCP data components
Experience with DBT, Stitch or similar highly desirable
Experience supporting QA and User Acceptance Testing processes
Knowledgeable on modern data architecture such as Data Lake, Data Warehouse, Lakehouse, Data Mesh etc.
Delivering incremental value through Scrum and Kanban methodologies


Competencies

Ability to find solutions when faced with challenges and be articulate when offering viable recommendations
Ability to interpret impact of changes to business rules on the data and data integration pipelines
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and able to write up and present findings
Self-driven and constantly striving to improve data
Analytical and agile mindset and ability to see the big picture alongside the value of incremental delivery
Natural problem solver who can make recommendations at pace
Ability to scope, estimate and deliver committed work on time, on own and as part of Agile team
Understand, if not live and breathe the mantra, that good quality data is the backbone of every business


Our Benefits

Great benefits make a big difference. Not just to employees, but to the whole vibe of a business. That’s why when you work for us, you’ll enjoy a full spectrum of generous perks, rewards and office benefits.

Competitive salary and performance-based bonus
Generous training budget
25 days holiday and Christmas office closure days on top
Allocated shares according to GWI’s share scheme
A range of discounts and freebies
Accredited learning and development programs
Enhanced primary caregiver and co-caregiver’s benefits
Flexitime and a great work-life balance
Health Cash plan
Referral bonus scheme
Mobile phone contract
Early finishes on Fridays
A well-stocked fridge and plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)
Commit a working day to charity each year
Social activities and team outings


Who We Are

GWI was founded with the knowledge that understanding your audience is really important for business. When you know who you’re speaking to and why, you can create content and campaigns that stand out to the people that matter.

Through our global online survey, we gather data on the behaviour and perceptions of consumers across the world. This provides businesses with deep, actionable insights on their audience, revealed from data they trust.

It’s been going well, too. Since launching in 2009, we’ve become one of the UK’s fastest growing target audience companies. We’re not about to stop growing any time soon. As a business, we’re on a mission to re-engineer data-driven marketing, and we’re on the lookout for talented people to join us.

Diversity & Inclusion

Imagine if our data came from just one kind of person. We’d get a very nuanced view of the world. And we definitely wouldn’t have got off the ground as a business.

Although things certainly aren’t perfect, we live in a society where differences are increasingly celebrated – so we’d expect nothing else from our teams. In fact, the GWI office is as diverse as our global data, it’s really important to us that it stays that way. This is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely and make your mark.


Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Are you stuck doing routine analysis and reporting?

Do you want to grow your skills in an environment that celebrates innovation?

As Data Analyst at LOVESPACE, you will play a key role in implementing the automation that drives one of the ‘UK’s Most Innovative Businesses’.

Data is at the heart of how we are revolutionising the storage industry. The insight you provide will influence the direction of the business, involving you in a level of strategy and decision-making you would never see at a larger company.

You will become the architect of all business and operations data nad reporting, empowering all members of the team and external partners to gain deep understanding and insight into the business.

You will also use your high-level analytical and problem-solving skills to develop actionable insights from our business and operations data, working closely with members of the team from all levels up to the CEO to help shape the future direction of the business.

You will work closely with the engineering team to translate systems data into business and operations data.

When you join us, you will already have these things: -

A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, Maths, or a similar discipline.
Excellent technical skills in Excel and SQL, as well as PowerBI.
You must already be eligible to work in the UK
You must be able to work at our London Bridge office 3 days a week.
Some experience working in a similar role with a particular focus on sales analytics, statistical modelling, forecasting, optimization, and predictive analysis.
You’ll be comfortable spending a lot of time in the detail, but equally comfortable providing, presenting and explaining complex data to non-data folks.
Also, if you tell us youve got consulting experience, well drop everything and see you right away. :)

About LOVESPACE

We’re not your traditional storage and removals business. We’ve been changing the way people move and store stuff for the last decade.

We built the UK’s first and largest storage-by-the-box business, and we continue to build smart tech to make it easier for people to move and store stuff on their terms, without the need to leave home or pay for more storage than they need.

We’ll collect almost anything our customers want to store, keep it all securely, then return it anywhere in the UK, as soon as the next day. Or they can drop off their stuff at one of our fully automated drop-off locations. We also offer home and business removals nationwide.

We are well on our way to becoming the first choice for Brits who need help moving and storing their stuff. In the past few years, we’ve been named High Growth Team of the Year, The UK’s Most Innovative Business, Crowdfunded Business of the Year, and one of the 50 fastest growing technology companies in the UK (twice!

Salary And Benefits

35k - £40k basic salary
25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)
Hybrid working pattern (3 days in office)
Staff discounts on our services, and access to Perks at Work programs
Pension contributions, with flexibility to increase your contributions
Summer, winter, alumni and social parties throughout the year
Events in the office, like Cake Wednesdays and drinks after work on Thursdays
4 weeks paid sick leave, and regular well-being assessments
Cycle to Work Scheme
Car Lease Scheme

!!! Every employee can choose to work from anywhere they want, up to four weeks a year.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

Starting salary: £45,042

Job Level: Level 4 Zone 2

Work Location: 5 Pancras Square, London, N1C 4AG

Hours per week: 36

Contract type: Permanent (x4 Roles)

Closing date: Sunday 12th February 2023 23:59

Interviews to be held: TBC




Alternative flexible working options available / open to discussion




Anonymised Application – in keeping with Camden’s commitment to inclusion the recruitment to this role is anonymised and supports the objective of reducing the impact of unconscious bias.




About us




Camden is changing on the inside to make life better for everyone. Because we’re not just home to the UK’s fast-growing economy. We’re home to the most important conversations happening today. And we’re making radical social change a reality, so that nobody gets left behind. Here’s where you can help decide a better future for us all.




The Role




These roles will be supporting a variety of people-focused services within Camden’s Supporting People directorate as well as work to deliver against corporate cross-cutting priorities, including our Refugee Support and Adult Social Care. In this role you’ll be using your skills in data to help us effectively support the people of Camden.




In this role you will be supporting service improvement and strategy development, policy and service design, having a direct impact on how we operate and best support the people we serve. You will be working with a variety of stakeholders from residents and front line staff to senior leadership. You will be assisting with developing Camden’s business intelligence architecture in collaboration with our Data Engineers and Data Architects. In this role you will get to play a leading role in project work across the organization as a Data Analyst expert, collaborating in a variety of roles to achieve objectives.







About you




You will have an understanding of data governance. As well as excellent oral and written communication skills that enable you present data in a clear way that technical and non-technical stakeholders will understand. You will have an understanding of different tools and industry-recognized data-modelling patterns and standards, comparing different data models, communicating data structures.

You will have a thorough understanding of national legislation and local practices in adherence to privacy and data handling.

You will use your experience of using a variety of tools such as MS Excel, Qlik, SQL, R, Python, QGIS, Tableau.




To find out more about what it is like to work at Camden, meet some of our People by visiting 'www.camdenjobs.co.uk/our-stories'.




Working for Camden




We’re ready to welcome your ideas, your views, and your rebellious spirit. Help us redefine our corporate services, and we’ll redefine what a career can be. If that sounds good to you, we’d love to talk.

At Camden, you’ll receive a host of benefits as well as joining a flexible working employer. Visit 'www.camdenjobs.co.uk/staff-benefits' to see full details of our benefits.




Additional information

To view the Job Profile for the Data Analyst – Adult Social Care, please click HERE or copy and paste the below URL into your browser: http://camdocs.camden.gov.uk/HPRMWebDrawer/Record/9918325/file/document?inline

To apply for this job please follow the "Apply" link. In the ‘Why you?’ section of the application you will be required to demonstrate how you meet the role criteria noted in the Job Profile under the “About You” section.




All applications will be considered for all roles. However, if you have a particular interest in one of the three roles specifically, you are encouraged to state this in the ‘About you’ section of your application.







Inclusion and Diversity




We want Camden Council to be a great place to work and to ensure that our communities are represented across our workforce. A vital part of this is ensuring we are a truly inclusive organisation that encourages diversity in all respects, including diversity of thinking. We particularly welcome applications from Black, Asian and those of Other Ethnicities, LGBT+, disabled and neurodiverse communities to make a real difference to our residents so that equalities and justice remains at the heart of everything we do.

To discover more about Camden and our commitment towards diversity, equality and safeguarding, please visit 'www.camdenjobs.co.uk/staff-benefits'.







Asking for Adjustments

Camden is committed to making our recruitment practices barrier-free and as accessible as possible for everyone. This includes making adjustments or changes for disabled people, neurodiverse people or people with long-term health conditions. If you would like us to do anything differently during the application, interview or assessment process, including providing information in an alternative format, please contact us on 020 7974 6655, at resourcing@camden.gov.uk or post to 5 Pancras Square, London, N1C 4AG,

Show more Show less
HTML:
Job Summary:

Starting salary: £45,042

Job Level: Level 4 Zone 2

Work Location: 5 Pancras Square, London, N1C 4AG

Hours per week: 36

Contract type: Permanent (x4 Roles)

Closing date: Sunday 12th February 2023 23:59

Interviews to be held: TBC


Alternative flexible working options available / open to discussion


Anonymised Application – in keeping with Camden’s commitment to inclusion the recruitment to this role is anonymised and supports the objective of reducing the impact of unconscious bias.


About us


Camden is changing on the inside to make life better for everyone. Because we’re not just home to the UK’s fast-growing economy. We’re home to the most important conversations happening today. And we’re making radical social change a reality, so that nobody gets left behind. Here’s where you can help decide a better future for us all.


The Role


These roles will be supporting a variety of people-focused services within Camden’s Supporting People directorate as well as work to deliver against corporate cross-cutting priorities, including our Refugee Support and Adult Social Care. In this role you’ll be using your skills in data to help us effectively support the people of Camden.


In this role you will be supporting service improvement and strategy development, policy and service design, having a direct impact on how we operate and best support the people we serve. You will be working with a variety of stakeholders from residents and front line staff to senior leadership. You will be assisting with developing Camden’s business intelligence architecture in collaboration with our Data Engineers and Data Architects. In this role you will get to play a leading role in project work across the organization as a Data Analyst expert, collaborating in a variety of roles to achieve objectives.



About you


You will have an understanding of data governance. As well as excellent oral and written communication skills that enable you present data in a clear way that technical and non-technical stakeholders will understand. You will have an understanding of different tools and industry-recognized data-modelling patterns and standards, comparing different data models, communicating data structures.

You will have a thorough understanding of national legislation and local practices in adherence to privacy and data handling.

You will use your experience of using a variety of tools such as MS Excel, Qlik, SQL, R, Python, QGIS, Tableau.


To find out more about what it is like to work at Camden, meet some of our People by visiting 'www.camdenjobs.co.uk/our-stories'.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Resource Solutions




London, Bristol, Birmingham, Salisbury, Southampton, Guildford, Open to Remote Work (hybrid)




Competitive Salary And Benefits Package




This is a unique opportunity to join one of the leading integrated wealth management and professional services companies in the UK!




About The Opportunity




Resource Solutions are a leading global provider of outsourced recruitment and consultancy solution. Resource Solutions supports organizations to build, connect and optimize their workforce to face the challenges of tomorrow.




Our client is the UK's leading integrated wealth management and professional services group. With £56 billion of assets under management (as of November 2021), they rank as the third largest UK wealth manager measured by revenues and the sixth largest professional services firm ranked by fee income (source: Accountancy Age rankings, 2021). They are driven by their purpose to place the power of good advice into more hands for both individuals and businesses.




Purpose Of Role




We are looking for an individual who has the desire to work on all things data from analytics for data transformation and data science in tax compliance. The job will involve interaction between Power Platform developers, tax practitioners as well as vendors of the technology tools. The successful candidate will be working with the teams to deliver technology solutions that offer automation and efficiency to the firm as well as becoming a subject matter expert for tax data.




Key Responsibilities Include




Working with the Tax Systems and Data team.
Presenting data using the latest visualization tools.
Data cleansing and manipulation projects ranging from data mapping, tax reporting, and insights gathering to KPI reporting for boards.
Optimizing client ERP systems and processes to support their tax, finance, or other data needs.
Configuration of tax software platforms.
Developing and implementing new data automation routines to help automate and improve processes.
Building and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders and providing high levels of client service.
Working with internal SMEs to identify appropriate processes for automation.
Presenting to stakeholders throughout the project life cycle, from proposal meetings to handover, and maintaining an excellent relationship with these stakeholders.
Managing time across multiple projects to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget.




Required Skills




Individuals should be Strong and motivated team players.
Technical skill set with data automation and as a PowerBI developer.
Designing, developing, and testing data automation workflows.
Providing guidance with process specification and design.
Supporting the launch and implementation of Power Platform solutions
Working with business analysts to define and deliver business-impacting projects.
A data analyst, with a skill set to manage and maintain all of the deliverables created to date
A candidate who is versed in SQL, Python, and other data Scripting technologies or has a strong desire to learn them.




My client offers an excellent working culture, with strong career progression and an inclusive and diverse working environment.




Apply Now and Grab this Opportunity!




(see below)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
£39,111 + 32% Pens (STC) + Flexitime/Hours + 3 days WFH a week

+ 2 days from our Stratford E20 Hub + 25 days holiday + Course Access + More.




About HMRC




At HMRC we are committed to creating a great place to work for all our colleagues; an inclusive and respectful environment that reflects the diversity of the society we serve.




We want to maximise the potential of everyone who chooses to work for us and we offer a range of flexible working patterns and support to make a fulfilling career at HMRC accessible to you.




Diverse perspectives and experiences are critical to our success and we welcome applications from all people from all backgrounds with the experience and skills needed to perform this role.




About the Team




HMRC Customer Insights Platform (CIP) team already provide a range of data analysis tools which enable our customers to make sense of the audit event data we hold, interpret customer interactions, and provide risk responses.




Within CIP’s analysis team, you would join our team of user support experts, on the front line, helping customers access and use of our suite of data analytics tooling such as Digital Persona, Superset, Splunk and Google Analytics to directly help improve customer experience as well as prevent fraud.




Job Description




Are you interested in data and how it is used to improve Customer Experience and protect against fraud?




Or perhaps you are already a Data Analyst looking for your next opportunity, or to join the future of data sharing across government.




As a CIP team member, you will use agile methodologies, adapt quickly to changing demands and help enable the team to deliver collective outcomes.




We will provide you with the tools, support, and expertise to analyse, interpret and understand data in order to improve service and performance.




This is an exciting opportunity for someone to join the future of data sharing across government. To be successful in the role you will:




Work alongside other Data Analysts to resolve issues and requests for support from users of CIP’s portfolio of data products.
Set up new user accounts for applications such as Superset and Splunk.
Coach users in search creation.
Ensure essential appropriate security clearance is implemented.




This role may eventually require the successful candidate to provide support outside of normal working hours.




Occasional travel with overnight stays within the UK may be required.




Essential Criteria




Comfortable working with remote teams and displays collaborative team working approach.
Strong focus on customer service, where working with customers in a technical environment, results in positive outcomes.
Ability to make key decisions, using own initiative.
Comfortable communicating with users at a variety of levels.
Capable of maintaining guidance on Confluence and/or SharePoint.




Desirable Criteria




Self-organisation, management, and planning of own work within the team’s backlog.
The ability to engage with business users in a clear and logical manner would also be advantageous since, as your experience builds, you will be expected to review business requirements, contribute to technical requirements, and provide assurances on delivery.
Proven track record on the use of SQL, Splunk and/or Google Analytics tooling.
Experience developing service dashboards, writing ad-hoc queries, and improving them based on feedback.
Communicating complex information in a manner that is understandable and in the most appropriate format.







Follow link through to learn more and apply before role closure at 11:55pm on Tue 31st Jan 2023

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Job Type: Permanent

Location: London, United Kingdom

Are you proficient in SQL?

Ready to utilise your experience in the field of data or business analysis?

Join us as a Data Analyst.

Careers at TCS: It means more

TCS is a purpose-led transformation company, built on belief. We don’t just help businesses to transform through technology. We support them in making a meaningful difference to the people and communities they serve - our clients include some of the biggest brands in the UK and worldwide. For you, it means more to make an impact that matters, through challenging projects which demand ambitious innovation.

Be exposed to the future of technology.
Work with some of the brightest global minds in the industry.
Support many of the biggest brands in the UK and worldwide.

The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with various teams, entail writing requirements for engineering teams, and perform data investigation on reported issues from the various stakeholders. The primary business hours would be during regular business hours, but it may require off hours due to the severity of the issue.

Your Profile

Experience writing functional and technical requirements.
Previous stakeholder engagement in functional/technical data warehouse/data

mark/data/lake teams.

Experience with front-end reporting tools and infrastructure.
Background in data analysis/research.

Good to have:

Knowledge of Snowflake.
Experience in fin tech.

Rewards & Benefits

TCS is consistently voted a Top Employer in the UK and globally. Our competitive salary packages feature pension, health care, life assurance, laptop, phone, access to extensive training resources and discounts within the larger Tata network.

Diversity, Inclusion & Wellbeing

At TCS, we believe in building and sustaining a culture of equity and belonging where everyone can thrive. Our diversity motto is ‘Inclusion without Exception’.

You’ll find a welcoming culture and many internal volunteering and social networks to join. Our diversity, inclusion and social activities include LGBTQ+ and mental health networks, as well as health and wellness initiatives and sports events (we even sponsor the London Marathon).

TCS celebrates inclusion without exception. We are open to all and treat applications equally, regardless of ethnicity, disability, gender, age, sexual orientation or beliefs.

If you are an applicant who needs an accommodation due to a disability to complete an employment application, or during any phase of the hiring process, please contact us at k.renika3@tcs.com

with the subject line: “Disability Accommodation Request”.

Due to a high volume of applications, we will be unable to contact each applicant individually on the status of their application. If you have not received a direct response within 30 days, then it should be deemed unsuccessful on this occasion.

Join us and do more of what matters. Apply online now.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Largely Remote Working - 1/2 days travel to London per Quarter




My client, a leading Utilities company, have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join their team and provide data driven insights, driving quality, growth and reporting in the business. This is a great opportunity to join a highly motivated, supportive, and experienced team in a role that provides a high degree of project accountability and ownership.




This role will be integral to their continued growth and development as a brand. You will need to work with all business departments and levels of management, to create and develop our internal quality reporting, presenting and working with internal departments to identify and manage data quality across multiple systems while also developing and providing reporting focused on data driven insights.




Their infrastructure modernisation over the last couple of years meant moving to Microsoft Azure where we use Azure Services such as VM Hosting, Azure APIM, Logic Apps and Web Apps. Capacity improvements have facilitated growth of IT services and their upcoming milestone is to improve the quality of the data in our CRM and finance systems, reporting and insights.




Initial focus will be on 3 core areas:

Consolidation and improvement of internal reports and Ad Hoc reports
Data import quality
CRM data improvements




Key experience from previous roles would include:

Previous experience with ETL processes and data cleansing
Experience of data gathering, documenting, analysing, and reporting
Experience using large relational databases
Experience providing data insights and interpretations to senior managers to support the decisions and business strategies




Technical Skills Required:

Transact-SQL including Stored Procedures and Functions
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience enforcing data quality
ETL processes
Data cleansing




If you are a self-starter who is exciting by the prospect of taking ownership and responsibility for a range of business critical projects, coupled with a passion for Data Technology (specifically within Microsoft stack) then please get in touch ASAP with your CV

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
This is a great opportunity for someone interested in data visualisation & web development to use and develop their skills to help tackle climate change. We are looking for candidates with fundamental coding skills and with a strong interest in building interactive and accessible data visualisations.




New AutoMotive is a not-for-profit transport research organisation with a mission to accelerate and support the transition to electric vehicles. We use vehicle data to show consumers how they can benefit from the EV transition and to help shape and influence policy to promote EVs. We are currently developing products that unlock the data to help people plan the transition to electric vehicles - a key part of the UK’s transition to net zero carbon emissions.




Requirements




Duties will include:




Developing tools for consumers to navigate the transition to EVs
Building dashboards and portals for people to access data
Helping process and store data
Facilitating the development of data visualisations and tools to make data accessible to a wider audience
Assisting with the production of digital products
Contributing to the creation of documentation and writing up methodologies
Other duties as required.




Essential




Skills and experience:




Familiarity with a programming language (ideally JavaScript)
Experience in working with large datasets
Willingness to learn




Desirable




Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g. python, SQL, R)
Basic knowledge of Git and GitHub
Scientific background (i.e. maths, physics, statistics)




You’ll be a key part of New AutoMotive’s growing data team, and have the opportunity to get involved with work that helps shape and influence public policy. We’re committed to training & skills - if you want to develop your coding skills then we will support you to do so. No prior professional experience is required, and recent graduates are encouraged to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – London & Lloyds Market

Location: London

Package £Negotiable + Benefits




Lonmar is going from strength to strength over the last few years, to ensure this continues we’re looking to appoint a Data Analyst to the team.




You’ll be working within the Binding Authority Division, which handles most non-marine classes of business for clients Worldwide.




Whilst embedded within the Lonmar team you’ll also be able to utilise the group wide data community and continue to develop your career.




Responsibilities:




Production of monthly Management Information Performance Packs
Working closely with clients and insurers in analysing performance to drive value from the data
Identifying new opportunities and build data models and dashboards to support
Supporting the journey of moving from descriptive to prescriptive analytics

Data analysis for new business projects
Data validation / cleansing
Manage the written premiums, paid premiums and claims statistics
Own the production of the earned to incurred triangulation figures for all clients and insurers




The Rewards:




A competitive and negotiable basic salary coupled with all of the normal benefits (Holiday, Pension, Share Save Scheme, DIS) as well as a range of flexible benefits post probation

A client first environment where the team work together to achieve common goals and benefits for clients and stakeholders

Full support for ongoing professional development including fully funded professional qualifications

Proficient in the use of MS Power BI and MS Excel, with a working understand of any of the Microsoft database technologies
Data analytical mindset
Knowledge of the non-marine insurance sector from a risk and claims perspective
Portfolio management
Problem solving capabilities
Ability to work on the own or as part of a team in different situations

Lonmar Global Risks are part of GRP, the GRP Group aims to be one of the UK's leading insurance intermediaries delivering the best outcomes to clients, insurers, investors and our people. We expect the same from everyone we hire. Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
London - England - United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Location: Canary Wharf, London

Initial Contract Term - 12 months (to be extended if required)

Company Profile

CBRE is the global leader in real estate services and leverages the industry's most powerful knowledge base to meet the commercial real estate needs of its clients worldwide. Our vision is to be the preeminent, vertically integrated, globally capable real estate service firm. Globally, we employ over 70,000 employees and operate in 48 countries.

Purpose of Job

The Data Analyst Support role will assist and report to the EDC ICE Product Management and Engineering team.

Primary focus will be on the collation, data cleansing and correction process relating to IT assets for the SETI and EDC locations globally.

The role will be responsible for managing the full data entry process through to completion and will focus primarily on producing reporting to identify the data discrepancies, raising change tickets for data correction and completing final data validation checks

The role will involve close liaison with members of the client’s global SETI teams and EDC Operation teams.

Due to the nature of the role the candidate needs to be highly motivated, proactive, willing to embrace change in a fast-moving environment. Able to work both collaboratively and unsupervised with a high level of attention to detail.

Working hours will be Monday to Friday 9.00am until 17.00pm (40 hour working week)

From time to time, the candidate will be expected to work at the alternate site.

Key Responsibilities

Participate and liaise as an active member and representative of EDC.
Support SETI and EDC data processing and corrective practices to sanitise data within in-house applications.
Managing and develop the full data remediation process
Raise and monitor work tickets in ServiceNow for EDC Ops teams and on behalf of SETI Tooling
Maintaining and improving database standards and policies for data entry
Close liaison with the SETI Tooling team to obtain data hygiene reports
Be a key part of the EDC ICE Product Management and Engineering team and assist team members with support of operational systems and procedures

Key Skills

Ideally educated to a degree level, or be able to demonstrate an equivalent level of knowledge and experience obtained through previous roles
Experience within a data analyst type role or a technical background in an IT or Infrastructure role would be very advantageous
Good organisational skills and a high attention to detail
Experience with operational use of 3rd party Configuration Management Database (CMDB) or IT Service Management (ITSM) systems i.e., ServiceNow, would be an advantage
Working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite of applications. Strong Excel skills are a key part of the role
Database experience would be very beneficial
Able to establish and manage relationships with internal clients
Good communication skills; both verbal and written
Dynamic, self-starter and highly motivated
Committed and strong team player

EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

We are an equal opportunities employer and do not discriminate on the grounds of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, gender reassignment, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age.

Service line: GWS Segment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB SUMMARY: Alan Gray Inc. is a rapidly expanding insurance consulting services firm headquartered in downtown Boston. We are currently seeking a dynamic and professional person to provide data analysis and in support of our various insurance consulting and ad-hoc systems development projects.




MAJOR DUTIES: This position is responsible for importing, creating, reviewing and analyzing various forms of data, designing and maintaining Access/SQL/Online databases, reporting data findings utilizing Access / Excel and Word, overseeing and actively participating in software implementations and effectively communicating the results of these projects to management. The person will research and identify any anomalies in the data, work well independently, meet deadlines and draft canned and ad hoc reports upon completion of data analysis. In addition, the position may require the transfer of data points from scanned/hardcopy documents into meaningful, useful data through scraping, OCR or other means of entry. Some travel may be required.




Qualifications




Qualified candidates will have either insurance-related and/or database programming work experience or a degree plus one to three years’ experience in a related field such as finance, accounting or business analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong computer skills, proficiency in Microsoft Access and Excel, experience with SQL and relational databases, including developing/designing databases and a working knowledge of accounting principles. An understanding of basic statistics would be desirable.




Alan Gray LLC is a leading audit and advisory firm with over 30 years of excellence in the insurance space. Our number one goal is to help our clients realize significant bottom line savings. We can adapt quickly to situational changes and our experienced team is committed to staying current with the latest industry information and advances in technology.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is an industry leading multi asset fund with an outstanding reputation here in Boston. This firm is known for an employee first culture and cutting-edge technology units. The team is now looking to hire a mid to senior level data analyst for their Boston office. Please note the firm can offer an H1b transfer and all candidates need to be able to come into the Boston office 3 days a week.

Work closely with Portfolio Managers, Traders, and other finance stakeholders

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
The Data Analyst is a professional position supporting the Agency Performance, Program Integrity, and Innovation Department in our project to prepare the DOL to procure products and services for an Enterprise Licensing and Permitting technology platform modernization. The Data Analyst is responsible for related data planning and the functionality therein that supports the business, which will mainly encompass the effort to cleanse, transform and model data with the goal of discovering and presenting useful information, informing conclusions, and supporting decision-making in the platform modernization project. The Data Analyst will assist the Project Manager in coordinating project activities, alerting the PM and team of out-of-scope activities. The Data Analyst will assist in developing Project Plan (Charter) and Statement of Work (SOW) and gain approvals.

Requirements

Responsibilities:

The Data Analyst investigates, documents, and offers solutions to data collection and data quality problems, including functional requirements, needed workflows, and accompanying data plans to improvements, close gaps, and to support the development of new applications and workflows within our technology environments. As such he/she must be versatile, a quick learner, and an excellent communicator and translator to understand and clearly express these concepts to the stakeholders involved. This position must be able to communicate to both

technical and non-technical staff and to translate concepts between those groups. Insufficient buy-in, resistance to change, and skill deficits are all challenges that will be faced by the incumbent in this position.
  • Acts as a liaison between Agency Performance, Program Integrity, and Innovation Department and other DOL Business Units;
  • Develops and reviews specifications for enhancements to the DOL's Enterprise Applications and associated database environments;
  • Determines which research method to use and how to proceed with research and analysis;
  • Determines which strategy is best for processing data and producing reports;
  • Extract data from various sources (data warehouse, SQL tables, Excel, among others). Work closely with system owners to define/redefine developed models;
  • Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems;
  • Perform analysis on report/query results to ensure accuracy in reporting and recommend solutions;
  • Identify patterns and trends in data sets and recommend changes/solutions to problems;
  • Define new data collection and analysis processes;
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality;
  • Design processes that operationalize the use of data in business decision making;
  • Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques;
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets;
  • Supports the organization’s key business processes and applications;
  • Gathers and documents business requirements;
  • Translates requirements into business, functional, and use case documents or operational artifacts;
  • Develops data plans to support application development;
  • Work alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs;
  • Test solution requests prior to implementation;
  • Generate reports, visuals, and presentations;
  • Assist in developing Project Plan (Charter) and Statement of Work (SOW) and gain approvals;
  • Alert the Project Manager to any “out of scope” activity;
  • Develop and maintain project information with collaboration tools such as SharePoint;
  • Maintain records of time spent on assigned tasks and provide information as required for project management and other administrative purposes;
  • Assists in the creation and delivery of related user documentation and end-user training when requested; and
  • Performs other related duties as required.

In practice, the position requires not only general technical expertise, but also specific substantive knowledge of the breadth and depth of the DOL business operations agency-wide, as well as the technical platforms, so that the challenges can be met. In meeting these challenges, the Data Analyst must display the following job competencies:
  • Supports the DOL's Mission, Ethics and Values in keeping with the general operational standards of the department;
  • Develops productive relationships with our customers and builds Subject Matter Expertise in their fields during engagements;
  • Understands and translates business unit functions and how information service operations, specialized tools, and software facilitate those functions. Uses this understanding to communicate value propositions and risk mitigation for proposed engagements and use case documents;
  • Demonstrates a commitment to continuously improve their knowledge of fast changing computer programs, hardware and software through professional development;
  • Provides exemplary customer service in a courteous and professional manner at all times to all DOL staff and the public we serve;
  • Works with others cooperatively, demonstrating a willingness to be a team player, and contributing to a work environment that focuses on shared departmental goals;
  • Accurately assesses workflow, data, and other process related problems. Recommends and facilitates best fit solutions.

Qualifications:

Minimum Entrance Requirements:
  • Knowledge of and ability to work with business data analysis, query design principles, data visualization, and/or statistical analysis.
  • Knowledge of business data analytics and use of business intelligence and technical tools to source and organize data.
  • Ability to create, prepare and present visual data and to engage in public speaking.
  • Ability to problem solve, use deductive and inductive reasoning, and apply critical thinking skills to complex matters.
  • Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Ability to use data analysis and business intelligence to interpret trends to support business activity.
  • Ability to prepare recommendations, reports and revisions based on business data analytics.
  • Ability to communicate effectively and build relationships with colleagues, superiors and internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of the methods of statistical report writing.
  • Knowledge of project management and business planning.
  • Ability to adapt to new tools and concepts in the field of Data Analytics.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Strong customer service skills;
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills;
  • Demonstrated ability to balance, prioritize and organize multiple tasks;
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in teams and across organizations;
  • Demonstrated ability to synthesize feedback and adjust plans accordingly;
  • Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships inside and outside the organization;
  • Basic analytical skills to evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, consolidate details and extract to functional requirements;
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively translate user requirements into business, functional and test scenarios for projects of various sizes and complexity;
  • Knowledge of formal software development life cycle methodologies;
  • Experience preparing technical documentation, including business process models, cross functional flow charts, data catalogs, technical project SOWs and project plans, and performance analysis documents. Ability to analyze complex issues and information relating to systems and programs;
  • Experience in designing program integrity checks;

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Liaison, we’ve helped higher ed institutions build better, more diverse classes for three decades. You may recognize us as the company behind the Centralized Application Service (CAS), Enrollment Marketing services and platform (EMP), SlideRoom, Time2Track, TargetX (CRM) and Othot.




Everything we do is focused on taking that proven success and expanding its scope and scale. Over 31,000 programs on more than 1,000 campuses see us as a forward-thinking partner integral to meeting their total enrollment goals — and we’re building the data- and mission-driven team that will reinforce and expand our role for decades to come.







Data Acquisition and Management

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other

strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data

systems

Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Tailor customer models to each institution’s needs and desired goals.
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Automate or help automate as many manual data activities as possible.




Qualifications




Education

Bachelor’s degree in information systems/technology, computer science, mathematics, or another relevant field required

Experience

Background or familiarity with statistics and business analytics
Advanced Microsoft Excel knowledge and proficiency in MS Office Suite

Skills

Ability to handle large volume of data
Capacity to work independently and as part of a team
Critical thinker
Manage multiple projects and deadlines

Data Analyst is sought to build and maintain data analysis scripts to support analysis of cognitive assessments and training programs that will support both analysis in UNITY Based Applications, AWS servers as well on personal computers. Current analysis scripts are in python and data visualization in R. The candidate will need to work well with both scientists, software developers and students to develop and document data analysis procedures.

40%

Title: Data Analyst, Onboarding
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join CooperSurgical and help build Embryo Options, the first business of its kind to help guide patients through the process of storing cryopreserved embryos, eggs, and sperm. Embryo Options partners with IVF centers to educate and assist fertility patients with making disposition decisions for their cryopreserved tissue. The IVF center and Embryo Options partnership enables patients to conveniently pay storage fees online, as well as gain access to comprehensive educational content and the world's largest embryo donation platform.




As more and more patients are freezing embryos, eggs, and sperm, our goal is to provide tools to fertility clinics that help their patients to navigate the complicated financial, legal, and ethical issues associated with cryopreservation.




As a Data Analyst on the Embryo Options team, you will work closely with patient data to help IVF centers take advantage of the Embryo Options platform and better understand their patients and their business. Besides helping clinics, you will also develop and visualize insights for the Embryo Options product team that will drive critical business decisions.




You Will:

Clean, analyze, and transform clinic cryo-storage data from disparate, unstructured sources like Excel, Microsoft Access, SQL databases, and CSV
Develop reproducible reports and workbooks to help launch new IVF centers on Embryo Options and keep their data accurate and up-to-date
Work closely with our Center Support team to communicate any data issues back to IVF clinics and EMR providers
Provide clear, reproducible analysis to help answer business questions for IVF centers and our product team
Develop intuitive, insightful data visualizations
Collaborate with our product team to identify new application features that help IVF centers better understand their patient data




You Have:

2+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, or a related technical field
Advanced proficiency in SQL
Experience with Excel as well as a programming language like Python or R
Experience designing data visualizations and dashboards using business intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker, Mode, Metabase, etc.)
High attention to detail, including experience with data validation techniques
Precise and effective communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to understand the underlying needs of the business and drive impact in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment

About CooperSurgical:

CooperSurgical is a leader in manufacturing and marketing multiple trusted and innovative brands that assist clinicians in improving the health of women, babies and families worldwide. Through an aggressive growth and diversification strategy, CooperSurgical has evolved its portfolio of over 600 products to include products and services used primarily by obstetricians and gynecologists in surgical and medical procedures wherever they occur: in hospitals, surgical centers, medical offices and fertility clinics.

For U.S. locations that require disclosure of compensation, the starting base pay for this role is between $70,000 and $90,000. The actual base pay includes many factors and is subject to change and modification in the future. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation and benefits.

Our Benefits:

As an employee of CooperSurgical, you'll receive an outstanding total compensation plan. As we believe your compensation goes beyond your paycheck, we offer a great compensation package, medical/dental/vision insurance coverage, 401(k), paid time off for vacation, personal, sick and holidays, paid family leave and many other perks and benefits. Please visit us at www.coopersurgical.com to learn more about CooperSurgical and the benefits of becoming a member of our team.




We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Show more Show less

Besides helping clinics, you will also develop and visualize insights for the Embryo Options product team that will drive critical business decisions.


You Will:

  • Clean, analyze, and transform clinic cryo-storage data from disparate, unstructured sources like Excel, Microsoft Access, SQL databases, and CSV
  • Develop reproducible reports and workbooks to help launch new IVF centers on Embryo Options and keep their data accurate and up-to-date
  • Work closely with our Center Support team to communicate any data issues back to IVF clinics and EMR providers
  • Provide clear, reproducible analysis to help answer business questions for IVF centers and our product team
  • Develop intuitive, insightful data visualizations
  • Collaborate with our product team to identify new application features that help IVF centers better understand their patient data


You Have:

  • 2+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, or a related technical field
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL
  • Experience with Excel as well as a programming language like Python or R
  • Experience designing data visualizations and dashboards using business intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker, Mode, Metabase, etc.)
  • High attention to detail, including experience with data validation techniques
  • Precise and effective communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences
  • Ability to understand the underlying needs of the business and drive impact in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment

About CooperSurgical:

CooperSurgical is a leader in manufacturing and marketing multiple trusted and innovative brands that assist clinicians in improving the health of women, babies and families worldwide. Through an aggressive growth and diversification strategy, CooperSurgical has evolved its portfolio of over 600 products to include products and services used primarily by obstetricians and gynecologists in surgical and medical procedures wherever they occur: in hospitals, surgical centers, medical offices and fertility clinics.

For U.S. locations that require disclosure of compensation, the starting base pay for this role is between $70,000 and $90,000. The actual base pay includes many factors and is subject to change and modification in the future. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation and benefits.

Our Benefits:

As an employee of CooperSurgical, you'll receive an outstanding total compensation plan. As we believe your compensation goes beyond your paycheck, we offer a great compensation package, medical/dental/vision insurance coverage, 401(k), paid time off for vacation, personal, sick and holidays, paid family leave and many other perks and benefits. Please visit us at www.coopersurgical.com to learn more about CooperSurgical and the benefits of becoming a member of our team.


We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
** LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY**




Position Overview:

We are looking for a motivated, organized, and analytical thinker to join our Operations Team. The ideal candidate must be comfortable corresponding daily on the phone and through professional emails with people in municipal departments. You must have strong attention to detail, communication, and reading comprehension skills. You must be results driven, growth oriented, and able to balance multiple projects at any given time. You must be able to think quickly and be an active problem solver. If you are experienced with real estate taxes, assessment, valuation, or real estate in general – this is the role for you!




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

● Engage in daily phone and email correspondence to obtain information from government bodies across the country as well as foster working relationships with those people

● Engage in persistent and professional follow-up with necessary parties and maintain working relationships

● Review, analyze, and archive meta-data points from commercial contracts, public records, and information gathered from correspondence with government bodies

● Search public records and online databases for property information, building permits, tax bills, and information related to clients and contracts

● Participate with executive Management Team on company growth strategy

● Prepare and present reports and to the Management Team

● Be a direct support to our Sales Team

● Be creative and have an analytical thinking mentality

● Work collaboratively with all departments to reach company targets

● Participate in regular training and success meetings




Qualifications:

● ● Bachelor’s degree or appropriate job-related experience

● Minimum of 2 years’ professional experience with a preference to those within the commercial real estate industry or experience with property assessments and/or real estate taxes (New college graduates with applicable Intern or co-op experience may be considered)

● Confident and comfortable speaking with others by phone/email

● Able to work independently as well as in a team environment

● Experience with research and data analysis

● Basic skills in Excel and Microsoft Office applications

● Strong organizational, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills

● Proven project management skills and experience handling concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy.

● Professional demeanor with a high degree of business acumen

● Creative, persistent, fast learner, and quick thinker - Problem Solver Mentality

● Must be able to handle rejection and overcome work obstacles




Compensation:

Commensurate with experience. Competitive Benefits Package including: 100% paid health insurance, dental, and vision coverage. Flexible Time Off and 401K contribution.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Boston, MA 02118

Duration: 6 Months

Hours per Week: 37.5

Position Summary
  • The Data Analyst is a professional position supporting the Agency Performance, Program Integrity, and Innovation Department in our project to prepare the DOL to procure products and services for an Enterprise Licensing and Permitting technology platform modernization.
  • The Data Analyst is responsible for related data planning and the functionality therein that supports the business, which will mainly encompass the effort to cleanse, transform and model data with the goal of discovering and presenting useful information, informing conclusions, and supporting decision-making in the platform modernization project.
  • The Data Analyst will assist the Project Manager in coordinating project activities, alerting the PM and team of out of scope activities.
  • The Data Analyst will assist in developing Project Plan (Charter) and Statement of Work (SOW) and gain approvals.
Responsibilities
  • The Data Analyst investigates, documents, and offers solutions to data collection and data quality problems, including functional requirements, needed workflows, and accompanying data plans to improvements, close gaps, and to support the development of new applications and workflows within our technology environments. As such he/she must be versatile, a quick learner, and an excellent communicator and translator to understand and clearly express these concepts to the stakeholders involved. This position must be able to communicate to both technical and non-technical staff and to translate concepts between those groups. Insufficient buy-in, resistance to change, and skill deficits are all challenges that will be faced by the incumbent in this position.
  • Acts as a liaison between Agency Performance, Program Integrity, and Innovation Department and other DOL Business Units;
  • Develops and reviews specifications for enhancements to the DOL's Enterprise Applications and associated database environments;
  • Determines which research method to use and how to proceed with research and analysis;
  • Determines which strategy is best for processing data and producing reports;
  • Extract data from various sources (data warehouse, SQL tables, Excel, among others). Work closely with system owners to define/redefine developed models;
  • Filter and "clean data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems;
  • Perform analysis on report/query results to ensure accuracy in reporting and recommend solutions;
  • Identify patterns and trends in data sets and recommend changes/solutions to problems;
  • Define new data collection and analysis processes;
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality;
  • Design processes that operationalize the use of data in business decision making;
  • Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques;
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets;
  • Supports the organization's key business processes and applications;
  • Gathers and documents business requirements;
  • Translates requirements into business, functional, and use case documents or operational artifacts;
  • Develops data plans to support application development;
  • Work alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs;
  • Test solution requests prior to implementation;
  • Generate reports, visuals, and presentations;
  • Assist in developing Project Plan (Charter) and Statement of Work (SOW) and gain approvals;
  • Alert the Project Manager to any "out of scope activity;
  • Develop and maintain project information with collaboration tools such as SharePoint;
  • Maintain records of time spent on assigned tasks and provide information as required for project management and other administrative purposes;
  • Assists in the creation and delivery of related user documentation and end-user training when requested; and
  • Performs other related duties as required.
In practice, the position requires not only general technical expertise, but also specific substantive knowledge of the breadth and depth of the DOL business operations agency-wide, as well as the technical platforms, so that the challenges can be met. In meeting these challenges.
  • The Data Analyst must display the following job competencies:
  • Supports the DOL's Mission, Ethics and Values in keeping with the general operational standards of the department;
  • Develops productive relationships with our customers and builds Subject Matter Expertise in their fields during engagements;
  • Understands and translates business unit functions and how information service operations, specialized tools, and software facilitate those functions. Uses this understanding to communicate value propositions and risk mitigation for proposed engagements and use case documents;
  • Demonstrates a commitment to continuously improve their knowledge of fast changing computer programs, hardware and software through professional development;
  • Provides exemplary customer service in a courteous and professional manner at all times to all DOL staff and the public we serve;
  • Works with others cooperatively, demonstrating a willingness to be a team player, and contributing to a work environment that focuses on shared departmental goals;
  • Accurately assesses workflow, data, and other process related problems. Recommends and facilitates best fit solutions.
Minimum Entrance Requirements
  • Knowledge of and ability to work with business data analysis, query design principles, data visualization, and/or statistical analysis.
  • Knowledge of business data analytics and use of business intelligence and technical tools to source and organize data.
  • Ability to create, prepare and present visual data and to engage in public speaking.
  • Ability to problem solve, use deductive and inductive reasoning, and apply critical thinking skills to complex matters.
  • Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Ability to use data analysis and business intelligence to interpret trends to support business activity.
  • Ability to prepare recommendations, reports and revisions based on business data analytics.
  • Ability to communicate effectively and build relationships with colleagues, superiors and internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of the methods of statistical report writing.
  • Knowledge of project management and business planning.
  • Ability to adapt to new tools and concepts in the field of Data Analytics.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills;
  • Demonstrated ability to balance, prioritize and organize multiple tasks;
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in teams and across organizations;
  • Demonstrated ability to synthesize feedback and adjust plans accordingly;
  • Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships inside and outside the organization;
  • Basic analytical skills to evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, consolidate details and extract to functional requirements;
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively translate user requirements into business, functional and test scenarios for projects of various sizes and complexity;
  • Knowledge of formal software development life cycle methodologies;
  • Experience preparing technical documentation, including business process models, cross functional flow charts, data catalogs, technical project SOWs and project plans, and performance analysis documents. Ability to analyze complex issues and information relating to systems and programs
  • Experience in designing program integrity checks;
  • Ability to communicate technical information to nontechnical people effectively
  • Ability to work effectively alone and as member of a team

Title: Data Analyst - Hybrid
Description:
Finance company based outside of Boston is looking for a Data Analyst to join their finance team. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented and highly organized with 1-3 years of experience in finance. Must be comfortable with data analysis and financial modeling!




Responsibilities:

Analyze financial records and policies
Compile client billing metrics for monthly revenue reporting
Complete and manage files for revenue calculations
Run queries through internal databases to extract and analyze billing information
Gather, manage, and manipulate data from multiple reports for analysis; identify trends, extract insights, and deliver actionable presentations of findings.
Provide recommendations to Development teams and Management teams based on analysis.
Work internally to resolve billing issues as needed.
Research current market trends as necessary.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or related field
1-3 years of experience in Data Analysis
Proficiency using MS Office Suite products
Excellent MS Excel skills including pivot tables and V Lookups
Saage experience is a plus
Detail-oriented and extremely organized
Proven ability to work under tight deadlines
Ability to identify errors in data collection
Proven critical thinking skills in data analysis

Title: Data Entry Analyst
Description:
POSITION PURPOSE



The Energy Analyst will be a key part of the SourceOne management team responsible for providing energy consulting support and maintaining good working relationships with all SourceOne customers.



PRIMARY DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES



Directly reporting to Supervisor of Energy Management
Gathering and consolidating data from varied sources such as Utility PDF’s, excel documents, etc.
Managing utility information for multiple customers on a daily and monthly basis
Entering utility information into EMSYS software or excel spreadsheets
QA/QC of utility data
Working on multiple projects at one time


Qualifications



Education / Experience / Background



BS/BA required preferably in Business, Math, Accounting, Engineering, or relatable field
Some energy, utility or related experience is preferred.

Knowledge / Skills / Abilities



Good PC and Microsoft Office skills, strong Excel and Word skills required; Microsoft Access a plus
Strong analytical/problem solving skills required
Attention to details and ability to review materials for accuracy
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong telephone etiquette
Ability/flexibility to learn and apply new skills
Ability to navigate through a variety of computer applications
Ability to prioritize work
High level of professionalism and integrity


Additional Information



Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement.Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.



A subsidiary of Veolia group, Veolia North America (VNA) offers a full spectrum of water, waste and energy management services, including water and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. VNA helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Mass., Veolia North America has more than 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across the continent. www.veolianorthamerica.com As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.



As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination.






We are an Equal Opportunity Employer! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Title: Risk & Data Analyst
Description:
Risk & Data Analyst

A large full-service bank managing billions in assets is adding a Risk and Data Analysis to its office in the Greater Boston area. The individual filling this role will analyze client portfolio data to provide actionable advice to aid management’s decision-making process. Focusing on Small Business, Commercial, and Residential Lending portfolios, this Risk and Data Analyst will create reports, gather portfolio data, and provide insights into trends and potential issues.

Benefits:

Medical, Dental, and Life Insurance
Paid Time Off
Annual profit sharing and 401k match
Work/life balance
Commuter benefits, including shuttle from Boston and subsidized MBTA passes
Education reimbursement, tuition discounts, and corporate discounts at select partners

Responsibilities:

Handle risk management reports for credit portfolios, identifying and measuring risk through data gathering and analysis
Ensure that reports are streamlined and efficient through collaboration with various teams
Analyze bank projects and create risk reports as requested
Aid with ad hoc projects for various business initiatives within the organization




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business
Prior banking experience required
Strong analytical skills with 2 to 5 years of applicable underwriting, lending, credit, and/or treasury experience
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office and Tableau/SQL (or similar software) with the ability to learn new software quickly
Strong attention to detail, organization, problem-solving, judgement, and collaboration skills







Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

The Hollister Group is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from people who are under-represented in their respective occupation or position.
