Title: Data Warehouse Analyst
Description:
A career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.







At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.

Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, one of BC’s Top Employers, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!







Responsibilities










Works with stakeholders to analyze business requirements and offers technical expertise on Enterprise Data Warehousing (EDW) solutions. Designs, develops and implements EDW solutions to ensure the accessibility, functionality, integrity, and security of the data warehouse. Supports, maintains and optimizes EDW process and all related components. Researches development technologies and tools to support and improve the implementation of EDW strategies and business intelligence services.










Qualifications







EDUCATION:










Diploma in computer science from a recognized institute of technology including courses in database design, programming, business and systems analysis.










EXPERIENCE:










Requires three (3) years recent related experience in data warehousing, business intelligence, information management or analytics. Must have experience producing information products for clients with a variety of BI tools. A further period of up to one (1) year in the position is required to become familiar with Translink information systems, policies, procedures, environment and its user requirements, as well as corporate road maps and corporate data models.







Other Information







Preference will be given to candidates with extensive experience in:







• SSIS (SQL Server Integration Studio)

• SSMS (SQL Server Management Studio)

• SQL Server







Beneficial experience includes:







• Oracle PL/SQL

• TOAD

• SQL developer

• Python

• C#

• Solar Winds Task Factory







Added advantage would be given to those with experience in;







• Azure

• Synapse

• Azure Data Factory

• DataBricks







Recruitment Process:




An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.










Work Schedule







37.5 hours per week.










Work Designation







Remote

This position offers the ability to work predominately in a remote capacity within B.C. The business will request onsite presence at times for operational reasons.










Rate of Pay







Salary starting from: $7,255 - $8,725 per month. (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity)







The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.




How to Apply







Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.




INSTRUCTIONS:




Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.




Posting Date: January 20, 2023

Closing Date: Open until filled.




Please note that only those short-listed will be contacted.




Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.







Equal Employment Opportunity







TransLink is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.


INSTRUCTIONS:


Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.


Posting Date: January 20, 2023

Closing Date: Open until filled.


Please note that only those short-listed will be contacted.


Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.



Equal Employment Opportunity



TransLink is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Data Governance
Description:
Come Work with Us!




At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.




Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.




Job Title




Senior Data Analyst, Data Governance




Job Description




What is the opportunity?




We are seeking a highly-motivated Senior Data Analyst to join the Data Governance team within the Data Management Office (DMO) of RBC Global Asset Management (RBC GAM). If you are passionate about data, please read on.




What will you do?
Ensure RBC GAM’s business data domains:
Are governed in accordance with the enterprise’s data governance standards.
Meet data quality standards established by data owners and producers, while meeting growing needs of its data consumers.
Act as a data SME to support the firm’s various project teams. With a focus on data governance and data quality, you will analyze, recommend and help integrate and implement scalable data solutions.
Conduct data quality issue analysis (e.g. root-cause analysis) and remediate as needed.
Build upon and drive the firm’s self-serve data quality monitors and dashboards.
Build upon the firm’s data literacy tool and promote the firm’s data literacy program.
Build data communities and promote a data-driven culture at RBC GAM.
Build standardized data sets that can be scaled for data consumers.
Work with business owners to standardize taxonomy and ontology.




What do you need to succeed?




Must Have:




Passion for data, and commitment to learn and apply various data capabilities to our data governance framework.
5+ years of relevant data experience.
Data governance skills (e.g. Data cleansing and preparation, business and/or technical documentation, defining and/or aligning business terms and taxonomy, etc.).
Desire to continuously bolster firm’s data governance (and data quality) framework.
Excellent business communication skills.
Ability to work independently and possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills.




Nice to Have:




Experience working with securities, product and market data within the investment management industry.
Knowledge of Eagle, SQL and experience with Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Tableau, Superset or Power BI.
Agile project management experience.




What’s in it for you?




We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.




A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits.
Interaction with a wide variety of departments within GAM and learn about all aspects of the business from a unique vantage point.
The opportunity to work on projects relating to firm-wide data initiatives, and collaborate with other platforms and functional groups across RBC.
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies.
Flexible work/life balance options.




Job Summary




Address:




TORONTO, Ontario, Canada




City:




CAN-BC-VANCOUVER, CAN-ON-TORONTO, USA-MN-MINNEAPOLIS




Country:




Canada




Work hours/week:




37.5




Employment Type:




Full time




Platform:




Wealth Management




Job Type:




Regular




Pay Type:




Salaried




Posted Date:




2023-01-24-08:00




Application Deadline:




2023-02-14-08:00




Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment




At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.




We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.




Join our Talent Community




Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.




Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

HTML:
Come Work with Us!


At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.


Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.


Job Title


Senior Data Analyst, Data Governance


Job Description


What is the opportunity?


We are seeking a highly-motivated Senior Data Analyst to join the Data Governance team within the Data Management Office (DMO) of RBC Global Asset Management (RBC GAM). If you are passionate about data, please read on.


What will you do?
  • Ensure RBC GAM’s business data domains:
    • Are governed in accordance with the enterprise’s data governance standards.
    • Meet data quality standards established by data owners and producers, while meeting growing needs of its data consumers.
  • Act as a data SME to support the firm’s various project teams. With a focus on data governance and data quality, you will analyze, recommend and help integrate and implement scalable data solutions.
  • Conduct data quality issue analysis (e.g. root-cause analysis) and remediate as needed.
  • Build upon and drive the firm’s self-serve data quality monitors and dashboards.
  • Build upon the firm’s data literacy tool and promote the firm’s data literacy program.
  • Build data communities and promote a data-driven culture at RBC GAM.
  • Build standardized data sets that can be scaled for data consumers.
  • Work with business owners to standardize taxonomy and ontology.


What do you need to succeed?


Must Have:


  • Passion for data, and commitment to learn and apply various data capabilities to our data governance framework.
  • 5+ years of relevant data experience.
  • Data governance skills (e.g. Data cleansing and preparation, business and/or technical documentation, defining and/or aligning business terms and taxonomy, etc.).
  • Desire to continuously bolster firm’s data governance (and data quality) framework.
  • Excellent business communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Nice to Have:


  • Experience working with securities, product and market data within the investment management industry.
  • Knowledge of Eagle, SQL and experience with Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Tableau, Superset or Power BI.
  • Agile project management experience.


What’s in it for you?


We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits.
  • Interaction with a wide variety of departments within GAM and learn about all aspects of the business from a unique vantage point.
  • The opportunity to work on projects relating to firm-wide data initiatives, and collaborate with other platforms and functional groups across RBC.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.

Title: Remote Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an Accounting Data Analyst to drive insights, generate actionable reports, and streamline our operations and trading data needs for the firm. Remote candidates will be considered.

Responsibilities:

-Querying, transforming and extracting data from our systems in support of various business functions including audit, finance and trading

-Identify and implement ways to automate reporting

-Build scripts to automate the creation of business reports

-Become fluent in our systems

-Data clean up and ensuring accuracy in data

-Write systems and process documentation (building entity relationship diagrams)

Required Qualifications:

-Bachelors degree in a quantitative field

-2+ years experience of financial data, reporting and accounting

-First-hand experience or understanding of accounting front-to-back workflows

-Proficient in Python (Pandas, Numpy, etc.)

-Knowledge of financial data, reporting and accounting

-Comfort working with time-series data

-Proficient in Excel

-Eager and willing to learn in a fast-paced environment

-Detailed-oriented with the ability to prioritize

-Strong written and verbal communication

-Ability to roll up their sleeves and do anything and everything to get the job done

-Someone who can work autonomously while also in partnership with cross domain teams

Preferred Qualifications:

-Familiarity with Python Django

-Familiarity with Jupyter Notebook

-Experience with industry-specific technologies to improve the efficiency of data collection Show more Show less

Title: Data Analyst, International Portfolio Management
Description:
Role Description

QuadReal is looking for a high calibre candidate to fill the role of Data Analyst, International Portfolio Management (“Analyst”). This position will report to the Vice President, International Portfolio Management. We are seeking a highly motivated individual with a background in Data Science or Data Analytics who is looking to develop their career in an entrepreneurial and high-energy environment. This position will play a pivotal role in the continued buildout of QuadReal's International data analytics platform.




Responsibilities

Work with a variety of structured datasets (sourcing, cleaning, and visualization); present results to various stakeholders and gather feedback for improvement
Assist in the preparation of regular reporting for senior management; look to leverage technology to automate these processes in a timely manner
Investigate opportunities to help improve business efficiencies, analyze portfolio management pain points, and maximize use of QuadReal's enterprise applications
Work closely with various groups to deliver best-in-class system implementation rollouts, upgrades, and process improvements every step of the project lifecycle
Design systems to automate the data collection and data load process for the International Real Estate team; aim to create reliable data to drive real estate market insight and decision-making for senior management
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members process stakeholders, support groups, business partners, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects
Maintaining and updating database platforms based on information provided by both internal and external partners.
Support process improvement and global data initiative adaptation by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the industry




Education and Qualifications

University degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field) OR a background in Economics, Finance or a related business field. CFA or similar a plus
Advanced knowledge of Excel (VBA and PowerQuery a plus); direct experience designing and creating data visualizations (e.g. PowerBI); good understanding of programming languages (Python/ SQL/ R); experience with real estate management system (Yardi) and Anaplan a plus
2+ years experience with data extract, transform, and load processes, data analytics/ visualization / database management
Accurate and detail-oriented with strong analytical skills; able to take initiative and work independently with minimal direction; able to allocate one's time effectively, work under pressure and meet tight deadlines; able to handle competing priorities, and adapt to new ideas/ constant changes







QuadReal Property Group will provide reasonable accommodation at any time throughout the hiring process for applicants with disabilities or for those needing job postings in an alternate format. If you require accommodation, please advise the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with and include the following: Job posting #, your name and your preferred method of contact.




QuadReal has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy that requires full vaccination against COVID-19 for everyone working in our offices or sites. Accordingly, a successful candidate offered employment at QuadReal will need to provide proof of full vaccination prior to commencing employment, subject exemptions permitted under applicable employment and human rights legislation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.

In return, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can help shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.

About The Role

We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst, to join our growing Accounts Receivable team!

Are you an innovative and analytical problem solver with a passion for driving results using data & technology? If so, this could be the opportunity for you!

We are currently seeking a dynamic Data Analyst to join the Accounts Receivable team. You will play an important role in the national billing ecosystem, working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to support current and emerging data needs within Accounts Receivable (AR), such as IFRS17 and migration to our new billing platform. People will count on you to produce queries, investigate differences, interpret & analyze data to provide meaningful insights, and propose solutions that build a best in class AR team.

Here Are a Few Ways You'll Make a Difference

Prepare queries and investigate differences between current (IFRS4) and future (IFRS17) state for billing accounts
Consolidate data from various sources, ensuring data is clean. Build and maintain an inventory of AR data and support the monitoring of AR related KPIs.
Produce AR reports in our new billing platform. Analyze and present information clearly and concisely to diverse audiences within the organization.
Proactively identify new data elements that may provide further insight into performance or business trends.
Identify and analyze trends, explaining outliers and providing influential feedback related to results and productivity.
Create and maintain effective documentation to assist in training and/or reinforcement of workflows & best practices, and to satisfy audit protocol.

Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

Bachelor’s degree in data related field (i.e. Mathematics, Science, Statistics, AI, Computer Science, etc.)
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in an analytics role
Excellent knowledge of programming languages: SQL, VBA
Excellent knowledge of Office Suite, particularly Excel, Power BI, Access
Ability to learn/adapt quickly to a changing environment
Strong communication skills in effectively working within an hybrid environment
Excellent time management & organization skills, managing competing priorities to meet deadlines
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills with high attention to detail
Experience with Accounts Receivable/Finance is an asset
Knowledge of Intact systems is an asset

What We Offer

Working here means you'll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a temporary member of our team:

Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow
Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues
A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs
Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities.
A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique.

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

If you are an employee of Intact, belairdirect, or Johnson Insurance, please apply for this role on Contact People.

Title: Data Engineer - Remote, Full-Time
Description:
Bluelight Consulting is a leading software consultancy seeking a skilled Data Engineer to join our fast-growing team. Our mission is to design and develop technology that improves the lives of its users while providing an exceptionally high level of service to our clients.




We are looking for Data Engineer who wants to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic environment, where everyone’s opinions and efforts are valued. We hire outstanding individuals and give them the opportunity to thrive in a collaborative atmosphere that values learning, growth, and hard work.




Our team is distributed across the United State and Central / South America. If you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, and rapidly-growing software development consultancy, and if you are passionate about software development and creating the finest apps in the marketplace, please apply below.




What We Are Looking For




Experience with AWS services including but not limited to S3, Athena, EC2, EMR, and Glue
Ability to solve any ongoing issues with operating the cluster
Experience with the integration of data from multiple data sources
Experience with various database technologies such as SQLServer, Redshift, Postgres, and RDS
Experience with one or more of the following data integration platforms: Pentaho Kettle, SnapLogic, Talend OpenStudio, Jitterbit, Informatica PowerCenter, or similar
Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills with a keen sense of customer service
Experience with collecting/managing/reporting on large data stores
Awareness of Data governance and data quality principles
Well versed in Business Analytics including basic metric building and troubleshooting
Understand Integration architecture: application integration and data flow diagrams, source-to-target mappings, data dictionary reports
Familiar with Web Services: XML, REST, SOAP
Experience with Git or similar version control software
Experience with integrations with and/or use of BI tools such as GoodData (Prefered), Tableau, PowerBI, or similar
Broad experience with multiple RDBMS: MS SQLServer, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift
Familiarity with SaaS/cloud data systems (e.g. Salesforce)
Data warehouse design: star-schemas, change data capture, denormalization
SQL/DDL queries/Tuning techniques such as indexing, sorting, and distribution
BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
3+ years of Data Pipeline development such as SnapLogic or Datastage, Informatica, or related experience
3+ years of SQL experience (No-SQL experience is a plus)
Experience designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines


What You'll Be Doing




Develop and maintain data models for core package application and reporting databases to describe objects and fields for support documentation and to facilitate custom application development and data integration
Monitoring execution and performance of daily pipelines, triage and escalate any issues
Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models and data pipelines that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision-making across the organization
Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes
Writes unit/integration tests, contributes to engineering wiki, and documents work
Performs data analysis required to troubleshoot data-related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues
Work within AWS/Linux cloud systems environment in support of data integration solution
Works closely with a team of frontend and backend engineers, product managers, and analysts
Teamwork: Collaborate with team members. Share knowledge, provide visibility of interpersonal accomplishments and follow directions when provided


Company Benefits




Competitive salary and bonuses, including performance-based salary increases
Generous paid-time-off policy
Technology / Office stipend
100% remote work, now and post COVID
Continuing education, training, conferences
Company-sponsored coursework, exams, and certifications


Being a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.




You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!




So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply.

  • Generous paid-time-off policy
  • Technology / Office stipend
  • 100% remote work, now and post COVID
  • Continuing education, training, conferences
  • Company-sponsored coursework, exams, and certifications

Being a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.


You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!


So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply.

Title: Strategic Data Analyst (Vancouver, BC)
Description:
FNHA Overview




The First Nations Health Authority is a diverse and transformational health organization of professional, innovative and dedicated team members and leaders.




The first of its kind in Canada, FNHA works as a health-and-wellness partner with BC First Nations to support self-determination and decision-making to improve health outcomes.




JOIN OUR HISTORIC JOURNEY




At FNHA, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to BC’s history. With a unique governing structure and mandate, our fluid work environment means you can play an active role in real change.




Our talented teams value respect and foster lateral kindness in their working relationships. Our holistic approach to wellness, based on First Nations teachings, is incorporated into all aspects of work culture. Where else will you get to create a personal wellness plan as part of your performance goals?




Position Summary




The Strategic Data Analyst, Regional Report Cards is responsible for the planning, executing, and monitoring process of developing a Regional Report Card with the Health Surveillance Team. This role collaborates with the community leadership, community health leaders/managers, Provincial Data Stewards, and others across the FNHA and throughout the BC health and wellness system, to define scope and objectives, develop detailed work plans and provide project status updates. This role provides specialized expertise in the research, design, implementation, and delivery of strategic data analysis with a specific focus on monitoring Anti-Indigenous Racism and Cultural Safety and Humility trends in the Health Care System. Designs and implements data collection and mapping initiatives, at community, regional and organizational levels.




As a health and wellness organization, the First Nations Health Authority has aligned with the Provincial Public Health Order released on October 14, 2021. We have a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for all employees at First Nations Health Authority. This policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If selected for employment, you will be required to provide proof of vaccination by providing a copy of your BC Vaccination Card Passport with the QR code.




Responsibilities




Provides advice and recommendations in the strategic analytical environment of the First Nations data sources by developing effective tools, ensuring consistency and validity in data, and collaborating on the preparation of final summaries and reports for FNHA stakeholders.
Collates the findings of First Nation data sources into practical formats, then analyzes and prepares reports and power points that are suitable for community, Nation, regional, and FNHA audiences.
Provides a leadership role in the development of data reporting capacity at community and regional levels, supporting community-driven, nation-based approaches which inform regional operations and priorities.
Builds data management capacity, including access to First Nations health status, health utilization and, through design and development of tools such as reports, infographics, and dashboards, and proactively identify potential data sources for inclusion.
Identifies potential data sources for health and wellness indicators and provides recommendations on the appropriate methodologies, reporting, and approaches.
Manages and completes assigned projects, such as internal or external data access requests and/or data requirements for policy or planning initiatives, proactively anticipating and resolving complex issues or delays and exercising judgment in escalating sensitive or challenging issues to management.




Qualifications




A Full Job Description is Available Upon Request




Education




Master of Public Health or Epidemiology, plus 5 to 7 years of recent, relevant, and significant experiences in data analysis and knowledge transformation, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.




Experience




Recent, relevant and significant experience in data analysis and knowledge transformation, usually defined as experience gained over 5 years
Recent, relevant and significant experience in health research and data analysis
Experience working with First Nations/Aboriginal Health




Knowledge, Skills & Attributes




Knowledge of research and data analysis methodologies and techniques
Experience collating multiple First Nations data sets to support First Nation health leadership in decision-making and health systems planning
Experience with report writing, community engagement, and developing data products for varying audiences
Knowledge of First Nations health issues, OCAP ® and associated data governance practices and their link to health governance transformation in BC
Knowledge of population health and the First Nations' perspective on health and wellness
Knowledge of statistical software through coursework or work experiences: Excel, Access, Tableau, R, QGIS, and Microsoft SQL




Closing Statement




Diversity




The First Nations Health Authority is committed to respecting diversity within our workforce; preference will be given to individuals with Indigenous ancestry (First Nations, Inuit, Métis).




What You Can Expect From Us




Joining our family means joining an organization that supports personal growth, in-house training, a paid volunteer day and a unique full-day orientation program.




Leading with culture, all FNHA employees complete San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training. We support our family to be leaders in wellness and all staff members develop a yearly wellness plan as part of their performance partnership and goal-setting.




Closing




Please note that only those applicants shortlisted will be contacted. If you do not hear from us about this position, please accept our sincere appreciation for your interest in FNHA!




For more information about us, please visit: www.fnha.ca/about/work-with-us




If you have any inquiries or issues please contact FNHA Recruitment at careers@fnha.ca or 1-844-699-3186.
Show more Show less

FNHA Overview


The First Nations Health Authority is a diverse and transformational health organization of professional, innovative and dedicated team members and leaders.


The first of its kind in Canada, FNHA works as a health-and-wellness partner with BC First Nations to support self-determination and decision-making to improve health outcomes.


JOIN OUR HISTORIC JOURNEY


At FNHA, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to BC’s history. With a unique governing structure and mandate, our fluid work environment means you can play an active role in real change.


Our talented teams value respect and foster lateral kindness in their working relationships. Our holistic approach to wellness, based on First Nations teachings, is incorporated into all aspects of work culture. Where else will you get to create a personal wellness plan as part of your performance goals?


Position Summary


The Strategic Data Analyst, Regional Report Cards is responsible for the planning, executing, and monitoring process of developing a Regional Report Card with the Health Surveillance Team. This role collaborates with the community leadership, community health leaders/managers, Provincial Data Stewards, and others across the FNHA and throughout the BC health and wellness system, to define scope and objectives, develop detailed work plans and provide project status updates. This role provides specialized expertise in the research, design, implementation, and delivery of strategic data analysis with a specific focus on monitoring Anti-Indigenous Racism and Cultural Safety and Humility trends in the Health Care System. Designs and implements data collection and mapping initiatives, at community, regional and organizational levels.


As a health and wellness organization, the First Nations Health Authority has aligned with the Provincial Public Health Order released on October 14, 2021. We have a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for all employees at First Nations Health Authority. This policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If selected for employment, you will be required to provide proof of vaccination by providing a copy of your BC Vaccination Card Passport with the QR code.


Responsibilities


  • Provides advice and recommendations in the strategic analytical environment of the First Nations data sources by developing effective tools, ensuring consistency and validity in data, and collaborating on the preparation of final summaries and reports for FNHA stakeholders.
  • Collates the findings of First Nation data sources into practical formats, then analyzes and prepares reports and power points that are suitable for community, Nation, regional, and FNHA audiences.
  • Provides a leadership role in the development of data reporting capacity at community and regional levels, supporting community-driven, nation-based approaches which inform regional operations and priorities.
  • Builds data management capacity, including access to First Nations health status, health utilization and, through design and development of tools such as reports, infographics, and dashboards, and proactively identify potential data sources for inclusion.
  • Identifies potential data sources for health and wellness indicators and provides recommendations on the appropriate methodologies, reporting, and approaches.
  • Manages and completes assigned projects, such as internal or external data access requests and/or data requirements for policy or planning initiatives, proactively anticipating and resolving complex issues or delays and exercising judgment in escalating sensitive or challenging issues to management.


Qualifications


A Full Job Description is Available Upon Request


Education


  • Master of Public Health or Epidemiology, plus 5 to 7 years of recent, relevant, and significant experiences in data analysis and knowledge transformation, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


Experience


  • Recent, relevant and significant experience in data analysis and knowledge transformation, usually defined as experience gained over 5 years
  • Recent, relevant and significant experience in health research and data analysis
  • Experience working with First Nations/Aboriginal Health


Knowledge, Skills & Attributes


  • Knowledge of research and data analysis methodologies and techniques
  • Experience collating multiple First Nations data sets to support First Nation health leadership in decision-making and health systems planning
  • Experience with report writing, community engagement, and developing data products for varying audiences
  • Knowledge of First Nations health issues, OCAP ® and associated data governance practices and their link to health governance transformation in BC
  • Knowledge of population health and the First Nations' perspective on health and wellness
  • Knowledge of statistical software through coursework or work experiences: Excel, Access, Tableau, R, QGIS, and Microsoft SQL


Closing Statement


Diversity


The First Nations Health Authority is committed to respecting diversity within our workforce; preference will be given to individuals with Indigenous ancestry (First Nations, Inuit, Métis).


What You Can Expect From Us


Joining our family means joining an organization that supports personal growth, in-house training, a paid volunteer day and a unique full-day orientation program.


Leading with culture, all FNHA employees complete San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training. We support our family to be leaders in wellness and all staff members develop a yearly wellness plan as part of their performance partnership and goal-setting.


Closing


Please note that only those applicants shortlisted will be contacted. If you do not hear from us about this position, please accept our sincere appreciation for your interest in FNHA!


For more information about us, please visit: www.fnha.ca/about/work-with-us


If you have any inquiries or issues please contact FNHA Recruitment at careers@fnha.ca or 1-844-699-3186.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for designing and maintaining critical business intelligence metrics in support of the National Shipbuilding Strategy and the Canadian Coast Guard and Royal Canadian Navy vessel construction projects underway at the Seaspan Vancouver Shipyards.




This position focuses on enhancing the accessibility of and business value derived from key organizational data. This includes both development of new analytics, and support of analytics users throughout the business as well as the development of innovative new methods of collecting, analyzing, presenting, or actioning data.




Note: Due to business needs, this position is required to be fully on-site based at 2 Pemberton Avenue in North Vancouver.




Duties & Accountabilities

Validate data sources, transformations, and analysis against reference data to ensure quality, accuracy, and completeness of derived reports.
Complete data discovery and mapping of shipyard enterprise applications.
Develops documentation of business requirements, data sources, infrastructure, and reports to provide clarity and context for data consumers throughout the shipyard.
Develop dataflows and datasets using Power Query, M, DAX & SQL
Build dataset requirements, metrics, data/report definitions and establishes reporting governance processes.
Optimizes and standardizes all stages of the data analysis process, from extraction through to modelling & visualization.
Collects, validates, interprets, and organizes various types of data into relevant metrics and reports and/or summaries for designated business objectives.
Supports ad hoc and other unplanned analysis and reporting needs as determined by management priority and business changes.
Collaborates with and provides training and knowledge transfer to business end-users of reports and data sources.
Coordinates with Functional Department and Program Resources to define, collect and report departmental, program and shipyards level metrics.
Acts as a Business Intelligence Subject Matter Expert (SME) by supporting team members in the use and interpretation of data and understanding of metrics and reporting requirements.
Understanding business objectives and providing ad hoc data extracts by working with business partners
Effectively use the main data sources for reporting purposes within the business unit and maintain expert knowledge of all of these data sources




Education and Experience

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business or a relevant field. An equivalent combination of education and/or work experience will be considered
Minimum 7 years of experience with business analytics, statistical analytics, KPI development and metrics reporting, preferably in a Program & Project Management environment with quantitative, financial or metric analysis on multiple large-scale data warehouses.
Experience with ground-up / full stack analytics solutions is an asset, including development of data sources, loading/transformation, analysis/modelling, reporting, and end user experiences.




Skills, Knowledge and Required Competencies

Well developed understanding of database structure, business object models, and large-scale data processing techniques.
Significant experience with Microsoft Power Query, M, DAX & SQL
Proven experience working with data and databases, including working experience with programming languages and business intelligence tools such as SQL and Power BI, to build dataflows, datasets and analytical solutions and create visual insights and dashboards
Familiarity and understanding of KPI analysis, performance measurement, financial systems and project scheduling/controls systems
Demonstrated data analytic skills including demonstrable ability to merge multiple data sources into substantial information, review incomplete data, problem solve to fill in gaps and provide recommendation for meaningful solutions
Deep technical communication ability, including the ability to clearly and concisely document and communicate complex data structures and process maps.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills for optimally communication
Well-developed organizational skills, including ability to prioritize a variety of work assignments
Experience with Azure Analytics Services, including Azure Analysis Services, is an asset.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and outstanding time management skills.
Experience with the Microsoft Power Platform, including Power Apps and Power Automate (Flow) is an asset




Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

Title: Marketing Performance & Insights Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
Working at Vancity you’ll be a part of a values led organization on a mission to change our world for the better. You’ll also be joining an organization that puts people first and is continually looking for ways to promote our employee’s well-being. This shows up in many ways, including: 



Generous vacation days (starting at 4 weeks). 
A defined benefit pension (you may have to ask around what they are as they are pretty uncommon these days) with generous employer contributions. 
Up to $2,400 towards self-directed professional development each year 
Flexible work schedules available. 
Remote work arrangements.

The Marketing Performance & Insights Analyst identiﬁes opportunities for future marketing initiatives based on past performance, insights obtained through analysis and/or research and develop solutions to track performance and to reach target audiences. If you have proven experience in this space, we want to hear from you!



In this role, you will:



Work closely with business stakeholders and marketing colleagues to deliver targeted marketing campaigns to support Vancity’s Member Contact Strategy.
Design and build solutions to provide ongoing reporting and tracking of marketing eﬀorts.
Deﬁne KPIs and conduct post implementation reviews to measure success of marketing campaigns & programs.
Analyze internal & external data to identify growth marketing opportunities to meet business objectives.
Apply organizational risk and compliance standards, policies, procedures and controls to meet regulatory requirements and mitigate risk.
Develop increasingly deep knowledge around Vancity’s products, services and members.

You are:



Resourceful and a self-starter
Engaged team player who is comfortable working in a collaborative environment and using data to make marketing decisions.
Passionate about leveraging data & analytics to drive business results.

You have:



Undergraduate degree in Business, Statistics, Computer Science or related discipline
3 - 5 years of proven analytics experience.
Solid research and analytical skills to perform qualitative/quantitative analysis, applying accepted methods to carry out analytical procedures.
Advanced knowledge of business intelligence techniques, data manipulation & data visualization tools such as Microsoft SQL Server, Power BI etc.
Financial Industry knowledge would be an asset
Experience working with Google Analytics and marketing automation tools would be an asset.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong relationship-building skills and the ability to work collaboratively
Exceptional attention to detail 

The team:



In this role, the Marketing Performance & Insights Analyst will report directly to the Manager, Marketing Performance and Insights.



Posting Deadline:  Open until filled.



At Vancity we’re committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive workplace to help our people and communities thrive and prosper. Diversity in our workforce is integral so that we can truly represent, understand and respond to our community needs and deliver on our member experience.



 



As part of this commitment we are taking action to learn more about our applicants and ask that you complete a short and anonymous Diversity Survey that will influence the design and execution of Vancity’s overall DEI initiatives and programs, one of which aims to advance our commitment to become a financial force for change and build a fair world.​ Please click this hyperlink to complete the Diversity Survey.  Your responses are collected anonymously and will never be linked to your job application.



 



Please note that all shortlisted candidates for this role will be required to complete a background check which includes resume verification, credit check, criminal record check. Vancity is an inclusive and equitable employer and actively seeks to advance racial equity, inclusion and belonging across the organization.



Vancity offers required accommodations in all stages of the recruitment process.  If you require an accommodation, please advise us, and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
JD




Skillset




Expertise in data modeling principles/methods including conceptual, logical & physical Data Models
Expertise in SQL, ability to profile many data sources and quickly rationalize data by detecting relationships, granularity and attribute classifications.
Experience working with Transactional and Dimensionally modeled data
Experience in translating/mapping relational data models into target Schemas for consumption
Experience with PowerDesigner
Azure experience/skills preferred
Ability to clearly communicate complex technical ideas, regardless of the technical capacity of the audience
Strong inter-personal skills and ability to work as part of a team




Responsibilities




Recommend Standards: Define data modeling standard for environments (OLTP/OLAP), best practices, and standards for naming, security, and lifecycle. Make recommendations for standardization and data usage - champion the usage of business data and communicate the benefits and return on investment for application and product owners.
Create current state and future state Conceptual Data Model
Identify/Map Business Needs: identify areas where data can be used to improve business activities, defining business users' requirements.
Create Data Models and build mapping specifications: Create optimal physical data models of datasets, then create and maintain data maps and systems interrelationship diagrams for data domains and systems. The implementation and design need to be optimized for Cloud solutions like Azure Synapse, Salesforce CRM etc.

Title: Data Developer Intern - May 2023
Description:
Who We Are

Olympic Industries ULC is a leading international forest products trading company with our annual revenue exceeding $500 million. Our expertise includes the trading, importing/exporting, and manufacturing of forest products from the comfort of our office located in the heart of the vibrant and breathtaking Lonsdale Quay in North Vancouver, BC.




Established in 1972, we have a strong record of success and a clear vision for our industry's sustainable future. With over 30 active Commodity Traders in house, we are proud to have a corporate culture that rewards hard work, entrepreneurship, and team collaboration.




Opportunity

Olympic Industries ULC is currently searching for a highly motivated and passionate Data Developer to join our team from May through August 2023. Working alongside the derivatives & data team, the Data Developer will gain hands-on experience upkeeping, designing, and implementing analytical models and software.




Responsibilities

The Data Developer is responsible for the following as well as other related duties as assigned to support the business objectives and purpose of the company:

1. Collaborating with the team in the design and implementation of analytical software:

Develop API endpoints on Flask with SQL database.
Develop dashboard UI on React with Material UI and chart libraries.
Analyze data for various departments and communicate findings to relevant stakeholders.




2. Building and upkeeping analytical models to provide a dynamic analysis of the business:

Perform code optimization in existing data projects.
Create statistical and forecasting models on complex inventory and trading data.
Create and improve automation processes for routine data processing tasks.
Testing and debugging programs.




Position Requirements

To be successful in the Data Developer position, an individual must be committed to developing, maintaining, and demonstrating the following:




Education and Experience

Working towards a degree or diploma in a related program such as Computer Science, Statistics, and Software/Electrical Engineering.
Experience in scripting languages, preferably Python.
Experience in web frameworks such as Node, Django and/or Flask.
Experience or knowledge in writing SQL queries and data pipeline.
Experience or knowledge in basic JavaScript, CSS, HTML, or frontend development.
Experience or knowledge in react.js, chart.js, recharts, and/or jQuery.js.
Basic understanding or interests in learning Material UI and Bootstrap.
Familiarity with good practices, programming patterns, and algorithm complexities.
Experience or knowledge in machine learning, data mining, statistical modelling and forecasting considered an asset.




Competences

Proven ability to complete work in a timely manner with exceptional accuracy and attention to detail.
Outstanding verbal, written, and visual communication skills.
Ability to use strong judgement in analyzing, troubleshooting, and evaluating problems.
Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks based on communicated expectations.
A high degree of initiative, work ethic, integrity, and honesty.
Ability to listen and understand instructions and work independently or with others to complete tasks.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word, and Excel.
Ability to act with good judgement and discretion: keeping sensitive business data secure.
Desire and capacity to acquire new knowledge and develop new skills, specifically in the commodities trading industry.
Ability to conduct research into systems issues as required.
High-energy with an entrepreneurial spirit.




Compensation

$45K-50K per annum.
On-site kitchen with a Nespresso bar.
On-site gym.







Why Join Us?

Small Company with Big Perks

Olympic is a mid-sized company with an open door/open concept layout where anybody you may need is easily accessible. This layout not only helps to support individuals in their career growth and development but also encourages individuals to interact and be curious about how different departments support each other in their roles.




Great Central Location

Located in the Lonsdale Quay, Olympic is transit accessible from any location in the lower mainland. There are many great shops, restaurants, and parks within a walking distance and the mountains are just a 10-minute drive away.




For more information on Olympic Industries, please visit our website at www.olympicind.com . To apply, please submit a resume in confidence to careers@olympicind.com and follow our company's LinkedIn Page.




﻿

We thank all applicants for their interest! However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. At Olympic Industries, we embrace diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, cultures, perspectives skills, and experiences. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from all qualified individuals.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Developer
Company: Lush Fresh Handmade Cosmetics North America
Description:
Lush North America supports more than 270 retail stores in Canada and the USA, and has manufacturing, distribution and online sales facilities located in both Vancouver and Toronto. We're known worldwide for our unique bath and beauty products, amazing skin and hair care, personalized customer service, environmental activism and a fun & funky store atmosphere. We are dedicated to the practices of fair trade sourcing and supporting sustainable communities as well as giving back to organizations that can make a difference through our Charity Pot Program.




The role of Junior BI Developer requires an enthusiastic and industrious individual with the strong ability to learn quickly and multitask effectively in our fast-paced environment. You are a fast learner, acquiring knowledge quickly, and can take ownership of problems and thrive at solving them.




You will provide professional support for the business to ensure they have access to accurate information that they need. The Junior BI Developer will be an important part of our Business Intelligence team, working with the various technologies we use at Lush.




Lush thrives with people that can adapt and evolve to the needs of our business. You have a passion for bringing value, leading change, and having an impact on the teams you work with. You are ready to join a business dedicated not only to getting the job done, but also to the practices of fair-trade sourcing, supporting sustainable communities, and giving back to grassroots organizations making a difference.




Reporting to th e Business Intelligence Manager, you will undertake the following RESPONSIBILITIES:




Important member of the team responsible for the planning, design, development, deployment and management of data, the data warehouse, BI & analytics solutions
Help instill a data-driven culture within the business to leverage data and turn it into information and actionable insights
Ensure day-to-day operations run smoothly for the data warehouse, imports, jobs, processes, cubes, reports, data extracts, and security
Able to handle several tasks at a time, and able to prioritize tasks and time
Work with the business providing support for questions, investigations, adding/maintaining data
Create/modify SQL stored procedures/queries to extract or analyze data
Create and maintain data integrations between various systems
Perform data validation to ensure data accuracy and cleanliness
Develop, modify, and maintain reports
Use best practices for coding, data management, reporting, and visualization
Implement database architecture and physical design based on requirements
Perform database server administration including: security, configuration, backup/restore, process monitoring, and accounts management
Analyze business and technical requirements and estimate project and task timelines
Create documentation as required
Work closely with the Technology team, as well as with others in the business such as PM’s/Analysts, across multiple projects and tasks
Strong willingness to learn, and apply those new learnings quickly




You bring the following QUALIFICATIONS:




Required:




2-3 years’ BI and SQL development experience
Proven experience with the Microsoft BI stack: SQL Server, SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, Visual Studio
Experience coding SQL stored procedures and queries
Strong experience importing and exporting data from various sources using SQL/SSIS
Background creating and maintaining reports
Experience with data cubes preferred, including adding new tables/columns, partitioning, processing of cubes
Strong investigative skills for looking into data problems/issues and resolving them
Ability to develop, test, and implement solutions from requirements
Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a cross-functional environment
Must be a quick learner in a fast-paced environment, acquiring knowledge quickly about the data warehouse, various systems, the data model, and processes
Ability to take direction for working on tasks/projects
Can work independently with minimal supervision, with good listening skills
Some availability outside normal business hours for support as needed




Preferred:




Experience with Power BI (or similar) is an asset
DBA experience such as managing databases, tables, indexes, data replication preferred
Experience working in a Retail or similar environment




Thriving with a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our staff and committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.




We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted.
Show more Show less
HTML:
Lush North America supports more than 270 retail stores in Canada and the USA, and has manufacturing, distribution and online sales facilities located in both Vancouver and Toronto. We're known worldwide for our unique bath and beauty products, amazing skin and hair care, personalized customer service, environmental activism and a fun & funky store atmosphere. We are dedicated to the practices of fair trade sourcing and supporting sustainable communities as well as giving back to organizations that can make a difference through our Charity Pot Program.


The role of Junior BI Developer requires an enthusiastic and industrious individual with the strong ability to learn quickly and multitask effectively in our fast-paced environment. You are a fast learner, acquiring knowledge quickly, and can take ownership of problems and thrive at solving them.


You will provide professional support for the business to ensure they have access to accurate information that they need. The Junior BI Developer will be an important part of our Business Intelligence team, working with the various technologies we use at Lush.


Lush thrives with people that can adapt and evolve to the needs of our business. You have a passion for bringing value, leading change, and having an impact on the teams you work with. You are ready to join a business dedicated not only to getting the job done, but also to the practices of fair-trade sourcing, supporting sustainable communities, and giving back to grassroots organizations making a difference.


Reporting to th e Business Intelligence Manager, you will undertake the following RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Important member of the team responsible for the planning, design, development, deployment and management of data, the data warehouse, BI & analytics solutions
  • Help instill a data-driven culture within the business to leverage data and turn it into information and actionable insights
  • Ensure day-to-day operations run smoothly for the data warehouse, imports, jobs, processes, cubes, reports, data extracts, and security
  • Able to handle several tasks at a time, and able to prioritize tasks and time
  • Work with the business providing support for questions, investigations, adding/maintaining data
  • Create/modify SQL stored procedures/queries to extract or analyze data
  • Create and maintain data integrations between various systems
  • Perform data validation to ensure data accuracy and cleanliness
  • Develop, modify, and maintain reports
  • Use best practices for coding, data management, reporting, and visualization
  • Implement database architecture and physical design based on requirements
  • Perform database server administration including: security, configuration, backup/restore, process monitoring, and accounts management
  • Analyze business and technical requirements and estimate project and task timelines
  • Create documentation as required
  • Work closely with the Technology team, as well as with others in the business such as PM’s/Analysts, across multiple projects and tasks
  • Strong willingness to learn, and apply those new learnings quickly


You bring the following QUALIFICATIONS:


Required:


  • 2-3 years’ BI and SQL development experience
  • Proven experience with the Microsoft BI stack: SQL Server, SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, Visual Studio
  • Experience coding SQL stored procedures and queries
  • Strong experience importing and exporting data from various sources using SQL/SSIS
  • Background creating and maintaining reports
  • Experience with data cubes preferred, including adding new tables/columns, partitioning, processing of cubes
  • Strong investigative skills for looking into data problems/issues and resolving them
  • Ability to develop, test, and implement solutions from requirements
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a cross-functional environment
  • Must be a quick learner in a fast-paced environment, acquiring knowledge quickly about the data warehouse, various systems, the data model, and processes
  • Ability to take direction for working on tasks/projects
  • Can work independently with minimal supervision, with good listening skills
  • Some availability outside normal business hours for support as needed


Preferred:


  • Experience with Power BI (or similar) is an asset
  • DBA experience such as managing databases, tables, indexes, data replication preferred
  • Experience working in a Retail or similar environment


Thriving with a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our staff and committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
HTML:
Business Systems Analyst, IT Application Support

Vancouver - Job #7038


Who we are:


Canaccord Genuity (CG) is a leading independent full-service financial services firm, with operations in two principal segments of the securities industry: wealth management and capital markets. CG is driven by an unwavering commitment to build lasting client relationships – we achieve this by generating value for our individual, institutional, and corporate clients through comprehensive wealth management solutions and investment banking services. We are a leading independent wealth management firm in Canada, and the leading mid-market provider of investment banking advisory, equity research, sales and trading services for corporations and institutions.


We pride ourselves on understanding our clients’ needs and finding innovative, bespoke solutions. Our entrepreneurial and friendly team will challenge you to learn and grow every day. We value great work and collaboration and strive to eliminate bureaucratic thinking. We’re looking for talented people who thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to have an impact with innovative ideas and best practices.


Come be a part of our Canadian success story and help deliver superior experiences for our clients. At CG, we recognize that diversity across our business strengthens our client relationships and enables more innovative solutions. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status. CG provides an accessible candidate experience. If you need any accommodations throughout the interview process and beyond, please let us know.


The Business Systems Analyst role is a key role that will work closely with the various IT teams, business units, and third-party vendors to manage enhancements with focused responsibility on information technology support and project work. This will require an ability to manage, analyze and synthesize complex system requirements and work with a diverse group of business users and IT team members to develop, implement and support solutions.


This position reports directly to the Manager, IT Application Support, and the successful candidate must be flexible to work after-hours and weekends at times; especially during production release deployments.


Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate second-level triage for production incidents, including technical analysis and application troubleshooting with the immediate team and other support groups;
  • Work with Back Office stakeholders and IT team members to complete current state analysis and business process redesign;
  • Interface with vendors by providing detailed business and functional requirements, and or details of a reported application issue for troubleshooting purposes;
  • Liaise with business groups and other IT teams in capturing requirement change requests, identifying business / technical impacts and managing client expectations;
  • Lead in testing of system changes and coordinate User Acceptance Testing by creating and executing Test Plans;
  • Assist in coordinating system releases to the production environment;
  • Perform post-production deployment testing;
  • Actively participate in daily change advisory board meetings;
  • Create and maintain system documentation, including operations manuals and team knowledge bases;
  • Exercise and promote service transition and operations best practices;
  • Build ad-hoc reports and data extracts using SQL;
  • Perform additional duties as assigned.



Skills & Qualifications:

  • Completion of a diploma or degree in a technical or business field with a minimum of 3 years of experience in a business systems analyst role or other relevant field;
  • Ability to organize and document system requirements;
  • Strong technical aptitude and understanding of practical uses of technology to solve business problems;
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and facilitation skills and ability to grasp abstract concepts;
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail;
  • Projects a mature, professional and optimistic attitude;
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment with moderate supervision;
  • Strong time management and organizational skills with demonstrated ability to set and commit to multiple deadlines;
  • Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing business needs;
  • Good understanding of quality assurance and testing methodologies;
  • Good working knowledge of SQL Server database with the ability to build queries and analyze raw data;
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of the XML, HTML;
  • Experience with Dataphile preferred;
  • General understanding of the finance/brokerage industry an asset.

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
This is a completely new opportunity with a Vancouver-based company that is looking for an experienced Data Center Technician to join their growing team. You will be based out of their Vancouver office location, and they have a hybrid work model, so you will work in the office 3 days a week. This is a more senior role on the team, and you'll report to the IT Director.




In this role, you will be working on all aspects of their IT infrastructure; you'll be working on systems and networking, so a diverse skillset is required. They work in a mostly M365 environment, with both on prem and cloud servers in place. Some of the work that you'd be doing would include maintaining their servers, fire cables, networking equipment and policies.




In this role, you will:




[-] Manage complex networks and configure networking equipment

[-] You will administer and manage NAS and SANs upgrades

[-] You will administer MFA systems and upgrade VMWare and virtual environments

[-] You will configure DNS servers and alerting systems




This is a full-time position that includes a competitive base salary, extended benefits, and paid vacation.







The interview process …




A bit about myself - my name is Tanvi Krishna, and I am a recruitment consultant based in Vancouver, BC. I am constantly working on IT and creative roles, and I am always looking to meet new people.




If you're interested in pursuing this role, please apply to this posting. If you are selected for the next stage, I will give you a ring. This is a chance for us to discuss the job requirements in greater detail, as well as your career goals and preferences for your next position. We can also discuss other opportunities which may fit what you're looking for.




Please feel free to reach out and find me on LinkedIn by searching my name: Tanvi Krishna







Requirements ...




[-] 5-7 years' worth of IT experience in a Data Center Technician/Engineer role

[-] Advanced understanding of networking devices and firewalls (Fortinet)

[-] Strong understanding of fiber optics networking

[-] Understanding of virtualization especially VMWare




[ VISA / RELOCATION SUPPORT ]







[-] Preference will be given to candidates who are currently in Vancouver with proper working permission to work in Canada

[-] No relocation or VISA sponsorship support will be offered for this role
