Title: Entry Level Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




Synergistic IT is a full-service staffing and placement firm servicing client in America for the past 12+ years. We are dedicated towards fulfilling the IT needs of our clients. From staffing to full implementation of projects we provide the highest quality IT Services. We Intend to deliver exceptional student outcome. We don't just help you secure a tech job but build a solid career in technology.




Job Description




Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.




Managing users and user roles




Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.




Generating reports from single or multiple systems.




Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports




Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.




Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.




Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.




S kill Required-




Data Visualization.




Data Cleaning.




MATLAB.




R.




Python.




SQL and NoSQL.




Machine Learning.




Linear Algebra and Calculus.




Education Requirement: -




Bachelors, Masters in Computer Science/ Computer Engineering/ Information Systems/Information Technology/ Electrical Engineering/ Mechanical Engineering.




B Enefits




On Job Technical support




E- verified




Full time position




Candidate who are missing the required skills, might be provided an option to enhance their skills, so that they can also apply for the role and can make a career in IT industry.




If you do respond via e-mail, please include a daytime phone number so that we can reach you. In considering candidates, time is of the essence, so please respond ASAP. Thank you

Title: Marketing Data Analyst and Research
Description:
Where it all began…




In 1951 SF Fire Credit Union first opened its doors from a modest 10′ × 15′ office space in 17 Engine. It was from those humble beginnings—where everyone pitched in to help one another in their community—that the organization forged its way of business forever. Today, the San Francisco-based credit union has grown to $1.7B in assets and a membership that extends from the regional firefighters we trace our roots back to throughout our many neighbors in San Francisco, San Mateo, and Marin Counties. Our members benefit from the ideas and principles that have shaped us: Shared trust, continuous innovation of products and services, competitive rates, and excellent member service. These qualities foster a true sense of member-ownership and strengthen the credit union’s bond with the people for whom this credit union was created.




What We Stand For…




There are a few things we look for those we hire at SF Fire Credit Union, regardless of role or team.




First, do they align with our values?




We win together.
We are of service to members above all else.
We are authentic, transparent, and honest.
We challenge the conventional with creativity.
We embrace diverse voices.




Second, will they thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and desire to innovate? Finally, do they share our vision to help empower members to accomplish their dreams and build lasting financial security in whatever way is most relevant to their role?




What It Feels Like…




Most days it feels more like going to work with a big family. Whether it’s a potluck lunch, baking birthday cakes for colleagues in the kitchen, or after-hours get-together, we’re here to do a great job and have a good time while doing it! We value a good sense of humor, are motivated by a higher purpose, and always bring an “in-this-together” attitude. While we’re driven to do great work, we also value real work/life balance.




Is This the Career For You?




SF Fire Credit Union is looking for a Database Marketing & Research Analyst who can conduct research, organize, analyze and interpret data to drive and support the company’s marketing efforts. They will be responsible for working with the VP of Marketing to develop and maintain campaign databases, lists and provide insights based on data analysis of current marketing efforts. Must be detail-oriented with ability to prioritize projects, be collaborative and manage deliverables that are aligned with business priorities. The role demands a highly analytical thinker with a firm grasp on the digital media landscape, the ability to craft compelling data-centric narratives, and strong project management skills. This individual will need to be able to isolate and identify meaningful and actionable trends and establish best practices based on historical and current marketing programming results that will influence future planning. There is high degree of collaboration required for this integrated role as you may also work closely with other Business functions (e.g., Business Intelligence, IT, Accounting) and agency partners to ensure data is being properly tracked and reported.




What You’ll Be Doing…




Collecting and cleaning data from core system, online banking, surveys and other digital marketing channels, including website analytics.
Collaborate with IT and accounting teams to ensure data is being properly tracked and reported.
Cleaning, sorting, and interpreting data to build campaign target lists, market research lists, member satisfaction trend lists, and member lifecycle lists.
Reviewing marketing campaign results (like revenue increase, reach, or engagement) to improve campaigns and report on campaign results.
Leads all aspects of research processes, develops research frameworks and innovative methodologies to enable and support marketing initiatives, ensuring decisions are made with strong insight from customers, driving efficiency, and mitigating risks.
Works closely with the growth and brand marketing teams, to successfully inform and develop data-driven, comprehensive, full-funnel growth, acquisition, and retention strategies.
Develop and maintain various dashboards and databases while communicating insights/trends to appropriate stakeholders.
Collects and analyzes data on member demographics, preferences, needs, and buying habits to identify potential campaigns, markets and factors affecting demand.
Researching peers and competitors and providing benchmarking data.
Understanding market trends and economic indicators.
Making data-driven recommendations on how SFFCU should proceed with marketing efforts, and when needed, making presentations to business and executive teams.
Monitor (weekly) campaign performance analysis and optimization recommendations.
Generate (monthly and quarterly) reporting and analysis of trends and support for optimization efforts.
Utilize and develop reporting to uncover key data insights and provide recommendations.
Lead and assist with special projects and other duties as needed




What We Look For In You…




Excellent verbal & written communication skills.
Demonstrated planning, organizational and interpersonal skills.
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow through.
Independent worker with ability to set priorities and manage timelines, flexible and adaptable to changing priorities and deadlines.
Strategic mindset and critical thinking.




This compensation range takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. At SFFCU, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $86,867 to $119,443.




Our Benefits




We have a competitive compensation and benefits package, but the true reward of working for SF Fire Credit Union goes beyond what you’ll see on a paystub. We genuinely care about our employees and we strive to invest in their professional and personal growth. We’re a relatively small organization with about 200 employees, so you can see the impact of your efforts and the value your contributions bring to our members and fellow employees.




401(k) and Employer Match
Health, Vision, Dental, STD/LIFE/AD&D and Life Insurance
Annual Incentive/Bonus Program
Tuition Reimbursement Program
11 Paid Holidays + Competitive PTO package
Home & Consumer Loan Program (Discounted Rates)
Professional development and training programs
On-demand personal coaching resource
Wellness Program (Discounted Gym Membership)




“Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.”

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Primary Skills




Python




Description




We are a small and highly motivated team who study and analyze user interactions with our customer facing applications.




We are looking to grow our team to focus on a data-driven strategy for making decisions.




In addition to looking at historic usage trends we are moving towards predicting how users will interact with our products.




We love what we do here and need someone who equally shares the joy and passion of working with data and driving product performance by building a sound understanding of our users through creative problem solving.




The ideal candidate is a great team player, has experience in predictive analysis, data modeling and familiarity to a multitude of technologies.




You should also have excellent analytical skills;




strong experience in writing Python code, SQL queries, designing database tables; and creating forecasting reports and predictive models.




If you are that person, we are looking for you!




Skills




4-5 years’ experience and proven track record in solving business problems through fact-based and scientific analytics




Comfortable in working with programming language Python.




Sound understanding of ML techniques for NLP




Advanced knowledge of Transformers and underlying concepts of neural networks




Experienced in working with Tensorflow, PyTorch and spaCy




Well versed with supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms.




Extensive experience developing Tableau reports.




Clear understanding of logical and physical database design and data.




Strong database skills (MySQL, SQL Server) and ability to write, optimize and tune complex SQL scripts.




Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team with diverse backgrounds and share knowledge.




Responsibilities




Make recommendations regarding collection, extraction and transformation of large data sets




Utilize statistical approaches to build predictive models (time series, clustering, neural networks)




Interpret data and analyze results




Translate analytical insights into clear recommendations; identify trends and patterns to inform business decisions and product design




Leverage Python to analyze complex data




Design and develop customized interactive reports and dashboards in Tableau; schedule in Tableau Server




Define and develop a data migration strategy between different products and platforms




Develop creative ways to identify and use data that significantly impact key business metrics




Assess the potential usefulness and validity of new data sources




Mentor other team members/ analysts to grow their skills and careers




Qualifications




Minimum Requirements:




B.S. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering or equivalent work experience




Education: Bachelors Degree

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Duration: 8 months

Contract Type: W2 only

Location: San Ramon, CA 94583




Summary:

Seeking a Data Analyst to coordinate changes to computer databases, test, and implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems.




Job Responsibilities:

Executes test, data extraction, and analysis utilizing the department's various computer software packages within established deadlines.
Prepares, and documents detailed specifications of the programs utilized to pull data. Includes: creation and use of documents to facilitate the request and data integrity of the data that is provided to the internal customer.
May analyze and make recommends on business, technology, and process improvement opportunities.
Partners with various business lines to perform data analysis procedures as applicable to the support of ongoing projects.
Generates ad hoc reports and regular datasets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries.
Work with senior management, technical and client teams in order to determine data requirements, business data implementation approaches, best practices for advanced data manipulation, storage and analysis strategies.
Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions.
Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.
Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
8-10 years applicable experience required.
5-6 years of experience on SQL or Oracle or Relational Databases.
5+ years of experience on advanced excel.
Knowledge of at least one scripting language.
Experience in building relational data structures, including relationships between tables and grouping data.
Technical skills to manipulate and analyze data in a variety of formats (e.g. SAS, SQL, Access, JCL)
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Desire to be working with data and helping businesses make better data driven decisions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Doximity is transforming the healthcare industry. Join our mission to help every physician be more productive and provide better care for their patients. As medicine's largest network in the United States, there's an elevated level of responsibility in everything we do. We don't take that responsibility lightly and are committed to building diverse teams with an inclusive culture that can make a direct impact on the healthcare system.




One of Doximity's core values is stretching ourselves. Even if you don't check off all the boxes below we encourage you to apply. Doximity is full of exceptional people who bring their own unique experiences to work everyday and make us all better for it!




As a Data Analyst, you'll work within cross-functional delivery teams alongside other analysts, engineers, and product managers in discovering data insights to help improve healthcare.




This role can be filled in our San Francisco headquarters OR remotely in the U.S.




About Us

Here are some of the ways we bring value to doctors
Here is an introduction to our tech stack
We use UNIX command-line interface and standard programming tools (vim/emacs, git, etc.) and have over 350 private repositories in Github containing our applications, forks of gems, our own internal gems, and open-source projects
We have worked as a distributed team for a long time; we're currently about 65% distributed
Find out more information on the Doximity engineering blog
Our company core values
Our recruiting process
Our product development cycle
Our on-boarding & mentorship process




Here's How You Will Make an Impact

Leverage Doximity's extensive datasets to identify and classify behavioral patterns of medical professionals on our platform.
Play a key role in creating both product and client-facing analytics.
Inform data team strategy by working with the product leaders and managers. Actively participate in execution and some planning of organizational data team strategy.
Collaborate with a team of product managers, analysts, and other developers to define and lead data projects from data ingestion to analysis to recommendations.




About you

At least 2 years of professional experience as a data analyst or a data scientist.
Knowledge of statistical concepts, especially exploratory data analysis techniques, and probability theory.
Excellent SQL skills to create and evaluate complex statements involving numerous tables and data relationships.
Excellent visualization and storytelling skills to explain your results and solutions to the stakeholders, clearly and compellingly.
Proficient in using Python data analysis libraries such as Pandas and Numpy. Also has a basic understanding of the object-oriented programming concepts as it relates to Python.
Prior exposure to distributed data processing concepts and execution (e.g., working with column stores, leveraging spark, etc.)
Fast learner; curiosity about and passion for data.




Benefits

Doximity is proud to offer industry-leading benefits. Some of our offerings include:

Medical, dental, vision offerings for you and your family
401k with matching program
Employee stock purchase plan
Family planning support, Childcare FSA, and parental leave
Life, AD&D, and Disability
Generous time off, holidays and paid company trips
Wellness benefits…plus many more!




More info on Doximity

For the past decade, it’s been our mission to help every physician be more productive so they can provide better care for their patients. We believe that when doctors are connected, the healthcare system works better and patients benefit. Doximity enables our verified clinician members to collaborate with colleagues, stay up-to-date with the latest medical news and research, manage their careers, and conduct virtual patient visits. Today, Doximity is the leading digital platform for U.S. medical professionals, with over 80% of physicians, 50% of all nurse practitioners and physician assistants, and 90% of graduating medical students as members.

Joining Doximity means being part of an incredibly talented and humble team passionate about improving inefficiencies in our $4.3 trillion U.S. healthcare system. We are a team of doers who solve problems everyday by treating obstacles like an adventure, and we love creating technology that has a real, meaningful impact on people’s lives. Doxers are committed to working towards a more equitable world both within and beyond our office walls. This starts by fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment where differences are valued and all employees are encouraged to bring their full, authentic selves to work daily. To learn more about our team, culture, and users, check out our careers page, company blog, and engineering blog. We’re growing fast, and there’s plenty of opportunity for you to make an impact—join us! For more information, visit Doximity.com.

____________________________________________

EEOC Statement

Doximity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




Synergistic IT is a full-service staffing and placement firm servicing client in America for the past 12+ years. We are dedicated towards fulfilling the IT needs of our clients. From staffing to full implementation of projects we provide the highest quality IT Services. We Intend to deliver exceptional student outcome. We don't just help you secure a tech job but build a solid career in technology.




Job Description




Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Managing users and user roles
Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports
Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.




Skill Required-




Data Visualization.
Data Cleaning.
MATLAB.
R.
Python.
SQL and NoSQL.
Machine Learning.
Linear Algebra and Calculus.




Education Requirement: -




Bachelors, Masters in Computer Science/ Computer Engineering/ Information Systems/Information Technology/ Electrical Engineering/ Mechanical Engineering.




Benefits




On Job Technical support
E- verified
Full time position
Candidate who are missing the required skills, might be provided an option to enhance their skills, so that they can also apply for the role and can make a career in IT industry.




If you do respond via e-mail, please include a daytime phone number so that we can reach you. In considering candidates, time is of the essence, so please respond ASAP. Thank you

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A tech company is seeking a Data Analyst to join their team remotely for a 6-month contract opportunity, with the potential for extension of permanent employment conversion. Apply today!

Pay: $50-60hr

Responsibilities:

Be the go-to analytical partner for the In-product Marketing team and PMM team for pre- and post- campaign analysis. Translate data into insights and action, communicate recommendations and learnings to the broader organization, and feed insights to update the creative best practices
Analyze performance, including performance for Lifecycle Marketing, for in-product marketing channels, notifications, and emails. Identify levers to improve click-throughs, downstream engagement, and more
Audience identification and opportunity sizing for in-product marketing channels. Help the team to determine metrics to focus for each campaign
Develop a set of tools and playbooks for the In-product Marketing team and PMM team to conduct high-level campaign analysis
Proactively work with engineers to improve dashboards, experiment setup, etc.


Qualifications:

Over 4 years working in a fast-paced environment analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets
Bachelor’s degree required in related field such as marketing, communications or business
Experiences analyzing lifecycle marketing campaigns
Strong communication skills and the ability to craft engaging and actionable insights stories for a variety of audiences using data
Experience in working with marketing or communications and the ability to translate technical data to consumer facing audiences
Ability to connect data analysis to real business problems to impact business performance
Must love building things and be passionate about making data and analytics accessible and easy to use for non-technical audiences
Fluency in SQL, Tableau, Excel, R, and/or other statistical and data visualization software
Track record of operating independently, demonstrating creativity, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a highly organized manner
A team player who is able to partner with cross-functional leadership to quickly turn insights into actions


#CB

Rate/Salary: $50-60hr

  • Proactively work with engineers to improve dashboards, experiment setup, etc.

  • Over 4 years working in a fast-paced environment analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets
  • Bachelor’s degree required in related field such as marketing, communications or business
  • Experiences analyzing lifecycle marketing campaigns
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to craft engaging and actionable insights stories for a variety of audiences using data
  • Experience in working with marketing or communications and the ability to translate technical data to consumer facing audiences
  • Ability to connect data analysis to real business problems to impact business performance
  • Must love building things and be passionate about making data and analytics accessible and easy to use for non-technical audiences
  • Fluency in SQL, Tableau, Excel, R, and/or other statistical and data visualization software
  • Track record of operating independently, demonstrating creativity, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a highly organized manner
  • A team player who is able to partner with cross-functional leadership to quickly turn insights into actions

#CB

Rate/Salary: $50-60hr

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities




Work with product, technology and business teams to drive complex data and trend analyses to root cause issues and propose ways to improve platform.
Responsible for defining, developing and communicating key metrics and business trends to partner and management teams
Model data in order to create reporting and dashboards for business process management and data mining.
Pull data required to conduct business analysis, build reports, dashboards and metrics to monitor the performance.
Work with the stakeholders to take data driven decisions.




Requirements




Strong understanding of math, statistics, calculus and game theory
Previous work in optimization spaces like resource allocation, pricing, etc.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Technical expertise regarding data models, storage schema, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of SQL and Hive queries
Knowledge in at least one programming language (Python, Java, Scala)
Hands-on experience in accessing data from NoSQL storages is highly desirable. (CouchBase, HBase, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc.)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (Excel, R, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Knowledge of JSON, XML would be a plus
Data visualization and reporting using at least one of Tableau, QlikView or Pentaho
Ability to work efficiently and effectively in fast paced environment with tight deadlines




Qualifications




6+ Years of experience in relevant role
Experience in retail industry would be a plus

Title: Data Analyst III
Description:
Description

Company Overview:

Zenni pioneered the online eyewear industry in 2003 with a mission to make prescription eyewear affordable and accessible to everyone. Based in Marin County, California, Zenni offers men, women, and children the freedom to express their personal style and individuality through high-quality prescription and protective eyewear curated with a sense for fashion and incredible selection. With over 50 million frames sold worldwide, a pair of Zenni’s is owned in every country across the globe. Zenni is proud to be the Official Eyewear Partner of the Boston Red Sox, Chicago Bulls and San Francisco 49ers. For more information, visit www.zenni.com or connect on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or Pinterest. 

Position Overview

To support our rapid growth, we are currently looking for multiple Data Analysts to be part of the Data Engineering team that analyze big data systems to enable a data-driven company. This position will be a valuable member of our team and is expected to open data visibility to the whole organization and provide key metrics to all levels of leadership to support decision-making.

Requirements

At least 2 years’ experience in the data analytics area.
Strong SQL skills is a must-have.
Proficiency with Python.
Solid query skills against all kinds of data systems.
Strong logical thinking and statistical skills.
Experience with BI tools such as Looker or Tableau..
A commitment to quality with velocity.
An enthusiastic approach to taking on new opportunities and challenges.
Strong communication and organizational skills to collaborate with multiple stakeholders and drive an outcome.
Willing to learn data engineering skills to better collaborate with the team.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Engineering, Math or Statistic fields.
Nice to have: experience with Github
(This position is open to candidates in both US and Canada)

Benefits

Your choice of PC or Mac hardware and accessories
Excellent health benefits that the company pays for
Annual employee eyeglasses stipend
Great Work Life Balance
Interesting projects with opportunities for growth and professional development in a financially stable, successful and growing company

Title: Data Analyst 2
Description:
Data Analyst 2

Job Summary:Talent Software Services is in search of a Data Analyst 2 for a contract position that can be worked 100% remotely. The opportunity will be Six months with a strong chance for a long-term extension.
 



Position Summary:
seeking a Data Analyst to coordinate changes to computer databases, test, and implement the database applying knowledge of database management systems.

Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:



Executes test, data extraction, and analysis utilizing the department's various computer software packages within established deadlines.
Prepares, and documents detailed specifications of the programs utilized to pull data. 
creation and use of documents to facilitate the request and data integrity of the data that is provided to the internal customer.
May analyze and make recommends on business, technology, and process improvement opportunities.
Partners with various business lines to perform data analysis procedures as applicable to the support of ongoing projects.
Generates ad hoc reports and regular datasets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries.
Work with senior management, technical and client teams in order to determine data requirements, business data implementation approaches, best practices for advanced data manipulation, storage and analysis strategies.
Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions.
Modify existing databases and database management systems and/or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.
Test programs or databases, correct errors and make necessary modifications.


Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
2-4 years applicable experience required.
Experience with database technologies.
Knowledge of the ETL process.
Knowledge of at least one scripting language.
Experience in building relational data structures, including relationships between tables and grouping data.
Technical skills to manipulate and analyze data in a variety of formats (e.g. SAS, SQL, Access, JCL)
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
Demonstrated history of success.
Desire to be working with data and helping businesses make better data driven decisions

Preferred:



Computer skills, which include emails, Word/PDF documents and Excel.
Good sense of prioritization based on importance and due dates.
Able to multitask

If this job is a match for your background, we would be honored to receive your application! 
 



Providing consulting opportunities to TALENTed people since 1987, we offer a host of opportunities including contract, contract to hire and permanent placement. Let's talk!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description Will work with the management team to design and maintain effective reporting, analyses and presentation of performance data. The successful candidate will be able to listen to business needs and create systems to identify and track business trends across multiple systems and put them all together. The data analyst will provide regular performance and production information in detailed format for internal review and analysis and in dashboard form for stakeholder review and overview.

Responsibilities

Acquires and presents data from all collected data sources
Designs and schedules reports in Chronicall, Crystal Reports and additional proprietary software
Develops and implements data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Works with management team and board staff to develop and implement automated quality control plans
Monitors performance and quality control plans to identify areas for improvement and reports exceptions
Develops measurement plans and dashboards, monitors metrics
Collaborates with management team on ad-hoc analysis to uncover root cause of trends to help predict future resource needs
Responds to management requests to extract data, design and produce reports

Required Skills

Expertise with SQL queries and Crystal Reports Designer
Proven work experience as a data analyst
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets
Experience with the following preferred: Excel, Crystal Reports, Crystal Dashboard, MSSAQL, SSRS, Chronicall, DocuWare and Relational Database Management Systems
Professional certification: MCSA: SQL would be a plus
Excellent written, verbal skills and math skills

BS in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics. Equivalent experience in addition to relevant certifications may be used in lieu of degree.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our large retail client is looking for a data analyst to join their team on a long-term W2 contract (12+ months). The data analyst will be responsible for interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques.




Candidates must be willing to commute to Irving, TX 3 days a week. All McKinley roles include a competitive benefits package.




Responsibilities

Perform data cleaning, data modeling, data crunching, and data analysis using SQL
Develop visuals and interactive reports using power BI
Analyze mobile app data to understand user engagement and retention
Utilize Excel techniques like pivot table, and V-Lookup for analyzing data
Supporting product teams through both ad-hoc requests and planned projects
Analyze customer data for new opportunities, providing customized reporting and recommendations
Conduct quantitative analysis (ROI, identification and assessment of opportunities and risk, forecasting, and more)
Perform A/B testing, test vs control analysis, market basket analysis




Requirements

Bachelor's degree
Strong background in SQL, power BI, data analysis and statistical concepts
Strong analytics background with mobile applications using Mixpanel or other tools.
Experience using Excel (i.e., pivots, VLOOKUP’s, etc) and PowerPoint ( i.e., charts, graphs)
Understanding of analytics concepts: Test and Control methodology (sales data analysis, loyalty program analytics, customer segmentation, descriptive analysis, cohort analysis, offers/promotions data trend analysis (coupons, bonus offers, rewards, member offers)
Statistical Concepts (probability distributions, confidence intervals, statistical inference, mean, mode, median, hypothesis tests)

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company
Description:
Company Overview

Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company delivers affordable, high-performance space systems for exacting customers. At Millennium, you will be part of a close-knit team working on exciting technological problems. We work in an open environment where ideas are shared across all disciplines, and there are ample opportunities for advancement based on excellence. Superstars are welcome.

At Millennium, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity, and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Job Summary

The Data Analyst will collect data, lead analyses, and develop strategies to drive efficiency at Millennium Space Systems. As a member of a small, agile team, they will have opportunities to contribute directly to projects that will help Millennium Space Systems achieve its long term manufacturing goals. Potential applications include identifying methods for measuring and monitoring core company metrics; analyzing data to optimize current manufacturing/supply processes; constructing and maintaining data pipelines from multiple systems; and utilizing historical manufacturing data to help generate forward forecasts.

This position’s internal job code is Business Intelligence Analyst. Our team is currently hiring for level range of 2-3.

Job Responsibilities

Collect, validate, and analyze data to support internal stakeholders and Millennium’s customers
Create and manage data workflows in order to increase data accessibility and streamline company reporting capabilities
Leverage data to support the development and continuous improvement of manufacturing processes
Develop Key Performance Indicators and report them periodically to stakeholders
Develop models of processes, and use those models to inform decision-making at Millennium
Build forecasts to aid Millennium in planning and executing our work


Minimum Qualifications

Two years of professional experience in analytical roles
Knowledge of Transact-SQL (and SQL Server)
Working knowledge of at least one programming language for data analysis, such as R, Python (including NumPy, pandas, and scikit-learn), or Julia
Familiarity with statistical methods, including time series forecasting and regression analysis
Experience interacting with and manipulating relational datasets
Experience leading at least one data-driven project with multiple stakeholders
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Detail oriented and highly organized
Self-starter and a team player


Preferred Qualifications

Five or more years of professional experience in analytical roles, including but not limited to Operations Research or Data Science; or Master’s Degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics or a related field
Experience working with API interfaces
Knowledge of multiple programming languages
Familiarity with optimization techniques and experience in formulating optimization problems
Experience working in an advanced manufacturing environment and/or government contracting


Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only of what is reasonably expected to be paid for the position. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Summary Pay-Range

Level 2: $75,650 - $111,250
Level 3: $94,350 - $138,750


Benefits And Perks

Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company offers a very competitive benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, and 401k plan.

Before applying, please note:

Millennium is DDTC-registered, ITAR-compliant Company. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Applicants MUST be U.S. citizens and eligible for a security clearance. Additionally, applicants must be willing to apply for and maintain a security clearance. We are proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage veterans, disabled veterans and disabled individuals to apply for any open position for which they feel they are qualified.

Applicant Privacy Policy
Show more Show less
HTML:
Company Overview

Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company delivers affordable, high-performance space systems for exacting customers. At Millennium, you will be part of a close-knit team working on exciting technological problems. We work in an open environment where ideas are shared across all disciplines, and there are ample opportunities for advancement based on excellence. Superstars are welcome.

At Millennium, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity, and inclusion are core values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

Job Summary

The Data Analyst will collect data, lead analyses, and develop strategies to drive efficiency at Millennium Space Systems. As a member of a small, agile team, they will have opportunities to contribute directly to projects that will help Millennium Space Systems achieve its long term manufacturing goals. Potential applications include identifying methods for measuring and monitoring core company metrics; analyzing data to optimize current manufacturing/supply processes; constructing and maintaining data pipelines from multiple systems; and utilizing historical manufacturing data to help generate forward forecasts.

This position’s internal job code is Business Intelligence Analyst. Our team is currently hiring for level range of 2-3.

Job Responsibilities
  • Collect, validate, and analyze data to support internal stakeholders and Millennium’s customers
  • Create and manage data workflows in order to increase data accessibility and streamline company reporting capabilities
  • Leverage data to support the development and continuous improvement of manufacturing processes
  • Develop Key Performance Indicators and report them periodically to stakeholders
  • Develop models of processes, and use those models to inform decision-making at Millennium
  • Build forecasts to aid Millennium in planning and executing our work

Minimum Qualifications
  • Two years of professional experience in analytical roles
  • Knowledge of Transact-SQL (and SQL Server)
  • Working knowledge of at least one programming language for data analysis, such as R, Python (including NumPy, pandas, and scikit-learn), or Julia
  • Familiarity with statistical methods, including time series forecasting and regression analysis
  • Experience interacting with and manipulating relational datasets
  • Experience leading at least one data-driven project with multiple stakeholders
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail oriented and highly organized
  • Self-starter and a team player

Preferred Qualifications
  • Five or more years of professional experience in analytical roles, including but not limited to Operations Research or Data Science; or Master’s Degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics or a related field
  • Experience working with API interfaces
  • Knowledge of multiple programming languages
  • Familiarity with optimization techniques and experience in formulating optimization problems
  • Experience working in an advanced manufacturing environment and/or government contracting

Please note that the salary information shown below is a general guideline only of what is reasonably expected to be paid for the position. Salaries are based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

Summary Pay-Range
  • Level 2: $75,650 - $111,250
  • Level 3: $94,350 - $138,750

Benefits And Perks

Millennium Space Systems, A Boeing Company offers a very competitive benefits package to include medical, dental, vision, and 401k plan.

Before applying, please note:

Millennium is DDTC-registered, ITAR-compliant Company. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Applicants MUST be U.S. citizens and eligible for a security clearance. Additionally, applicants must be willing to apply for and maintain a security clearance. We are proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage veterans, disabled veterans and disabled individuals to apply for any open position for which they feel they are qualified.

Applicant Privacy Policy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Reference #




269076BR




Job Type




Full Time




Your role




Are you an analytical data expert who has the technical skills to solve complex problems – and the curiosity to explore what problems need to be solved? Are you part mathematician, part computer scientist, part program manager and part trend-spotter? Do you like to play between both the business and IT worlds? Do you use technology-driven processes, technologies, and architectures that convert raw data into actionable information which drives informed/profitable actions. Are you interested in AML (Anti Money Laundering) and how to apply data science to solve some of the world’s most complex problems?




Do you think about big data as a gold mine that unearths business insights and transforms how decisions are made. Do you apply scientific methods, processes, algorithms and systems to extract knowledge and insights from noisy, structured and unstructured data, and apply knowledge from data across a broad range of application domains. To you look at complex issues and break them down to their core elements?




Are you a skilled Project manager, skilled at planning, executing and completing projects from initiation, planning, execution, monitoring to control and closure?




We are looking for a Data Analyst who can:





enable effective and efficient compliance with new or changing regulations, develop and propose changes to reporting, data management (including metadata management and data access technologies), processes, products, etc.
handle business wide reporting - Prepare, design, and develop reporting tools, targeting senior management audience with data gathering and modeling strategies.
conduct system wide audits to ensure a high level of scrutiny, accuracy, and efficiency to evaluate and mitigate business and sector risk.
introduce process improvement steps and controls throughout the reporting process, while maintaining the integrity of the data.
track progress against agreed remediation deadlines and actively manage key support areas to monitor and escalate issues.





Project Coordination and Management:





manage all aspects of regulatory change projects, including project planning, reporting, execution, timing, quality, cost, risks, resources and overall project governance.
work closely with and establish effective communication channels with key stakeholders, SME's and clients to gather project requirements, specifications and limitations in order to develop state of the art reporting capabilities.
communicate effectively across all levels of the organization, with ability to influence and challenge key decision makers, peer groups, internal service providers and functions outside direct control





Your team




We are a team within Wealth Management USA that supports the COO organization. This role is across all the US Lines of business (CUSO wide)




Your expertise





statistical analysis and reporting, process reengineering
develop forecasting models and other analytics
Data preparation: the process of converting raw data into another format so it can be more easily consumed.
Text analytics: the process of examining unstructured data to glean key business insights.
Data visualization: analyze current and historical data and presents findings in easy-to-digest reports, dashboards, graphs, charts, and maps that can be shared
Program management, ownership, and entrepreneurism





Software applications and programming languages: SQL, Python, MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio), SharePoint, and Tableau.




About Us




UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.




With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?




Join us




At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.




From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?




Disclaimer / Policy Statements




UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.




Your Career Comeback




We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TruConnect is on a mission to bridge the digital divide in the United States by delivering premium wireless services to underserved communities. We have connected millions of Americans over the past decade and experiencing substantial growth as the government places significant resources to help bridge the digital divide.

The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, well-organized, creative, empathetic, and proactive. You build trust & strong relationships at all levels. You are confident and can influence without formal authority, pushing back when appropriate. You earn respect and respect contributions of others.

 




DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

Demonstrable experience of using relational databases and Cloud Data environments via writing performant queries in SQL against multi-terabyte and billion row datasets in AWS Redshift/Spectrum, MS SQL, and MySQL
Transform data-based observations and insights into hypotheses through analytical rigor, leading to use cases that will confirm or deny those hypotheses and ultimately improve the quality of data
Demonstrate critical thinking around business rules and logic especially as it pertains to compensation models and other analytic models
Design appropriate data structures by gathering data from primary and secondary sources for reporting consumption
Troubleshoot, research, and identify discrepancies specifically around data such as inventory, compensation, claims/reimbursements, general sales activity, and other such related data
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Create structured data marts for current and historical reporting
Detail oriented and deadline driven to meet monthly filing deadlines
Assist in data governance, meta data management and quality control of the completeness and accuracy of data
Work with end users to follow through with associated action items and execute in a timely manner
Design and document process and data flows for establishing data pipelines to support detailed analyses and accuracy in reporting
Present analyses, translate findings in the data into solutions, and perform root cause analysis in a concise manner which is easy to interpret and understand

 

 

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

Bachelor’s degree is required. A degree in economics, finance, computer science, statistics, or other data related field preferred
Experience working with ETL tools such as Matillion, AWS Glue, SSIS, etc.
Working knowledge of BI reporting tools such as Tableau or similar tools
Strong product development mindset and focus on actionable analytics
Ability to clearly communicate with cross functional teams
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Translate business requirements into technical requirements
Work with business stakeholders to assess potential risks
Minimum of 2 years of BI/reporting/data analysis experience
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills
Analyze problems and provide automated solutions whenever possible
Working knowledge and experience with Agile/Scrum methodology and iterative practices in a service delivery lifecycle
Experience with online collaboration tools such as Slack, JIRA, or MS Teams is a plus
Consistent demonstration of organization, prioritization, self-motivation, and problem resolution skills
Ability to navigate between multiple projects, meet deadlines, and process ad hoc requests
Ability to deal with ambiguity and influence change in a rapidly changing business environment
Great interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to provide insights to support key business decision making
MUST be able to work from the Los Angeles Office 3-4 days/week

 

BENEFITS:

401(k) matching
Medical insurance, including PPO & HSA
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Flexible Spending Account(s)
Free Life & Long-Term Disability Insurance
Free Identity Theft Protection & Travel Assistance
Access to corporate discount program
Flexible schedule
Paid time off (sick, bereavement, and Flex PTO)
Parental leave

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Desired Skills and Experience

1+ year of data analysis, technical documentation, technical writing, data entry, etc.
Experience with Microsoft Excel (creating formulas)
Strong attention to detail

Day-to-Day

An employer is looking for a Jr. Data Analyst in the Denver, Co area. The Jr. Data Analyst will be responsible for researching, preparing, and editing technical documents, ensuring documents meet editorial and engineering specifications and adhere to standards for quality, graphics, format, and style. They will also be interacting with engineers and subject matter experts specialized in coordinating and preparing the edited draft. They will be participating in the publishing of formatted documentation in various media, maintaining current knowledge of relevant technical subject matter as assigned, and participating as a member of the project teams.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description Summary




Data analyst serves critically in upcoming and ongoing project’s planning process by preparing and analyzing detailed reports related to overall management in sales and operations. As a Data Analyst you will develop reports using our database allowing us to better manage the business. These reports will be used as a management tool to identify and manage the complete business process.




Job Description




Responsibilities:




Developing and executing processes for monitoring, maintaining, and improving and restoring quality of our database
Creating or upgrading reports by integration of new data sources in cooperation with other teams
Define data requirements, gather missing data, and reconcile existing data accordingly
Utilized Excel, R, Python, SQL in capturing, analyzing, managing and forecasting sales
Assisting various team or cross-functional projects to build more efficient processes through innovations
Researching leading software/solution tools to leverage our company’s operation
Develop ad-hoc reports per managers’ requests




Knowledge/experience, Skills, Ability & Attitude




Bachelor’s degree in fields such as data science, computer science, business analytics.
Experience of working with large data sets using a range of statistical and segmentation techniques.
Good mastery of data analysis, data forecasting and database management
Strong technical skills in using Excel, R, Python or SQL
Strong skills using data processing & data visualization software (Microsoft Excel, Python, or PowerBI)
Strong attention to detail and time management skills
Ability to write detailed instructions based on practical use cases
Taking initiatives, passion to work, and posses good analytic concepts

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary: Our client is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join their hybrid team in Chicago, IL. The client is revamping their cybersecurity protocols surrounding their application vulnerabilities to identify and remediate current and future risk/threat potentials. So, the Data Analyst’s responsibility is to identify in datasets any and all vulnerabilities, risks, threats to all applications. They will analyze, clean, and build reports from data to identify areas of potential vulnerabilities/threats to applications. They will provide findings to the project team(s) to build and execute solutions to remediate those threats.




Duties:

Collect, transform, and interpret large data sets
Pull, clean and analyze data from various databases, systems and platforms monitoring the performance and health of utilized applications
Build functions in Excel
Maintain proficiency in Excel and running functions
Visualize and create visualizations for individuals




​​​​​​​Desired Skills/Experience:

Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel (VLOOKUPs, HLOOKUPs, and the ability to quickly clean and merge large data sets)
Ability to write own function and macros to clean large data sets
Ability to extract business value from the information they are seeing for the business user
Experience with visualization tools such as Spotfire, Tableau, PowerBI
Cybersecurity experience (preferred)
Qualys, Vericode experience (preferred)




Benefits:

Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance Plans
401K offered

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
** LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY**




Position Overview:

We are looking for a motivated, organized, and analytical thinker to join our Operations Team. The ideal candidate must be comfortable corresponding daily on the phone and through professional emails with people in municipal departments. You must have strong attention to detail, communication, and reading comprehension skills. You must be results driven, growth oriented, and able to balance multiple projects at any given time. You must be able to think quickly and be an active problem solver. If you are experienced with real estate taxes, assessment, valuation, or real estate in general – this is the role for you!




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

● Engage in daily phone and email correspondence to obtain information from government bodies across the country as well as foster working relationships with those people

● Engage in persistent and professional follow-up with necessary parties and maintain working relationships

● Review, analyze, and archive meta-data points from commercial contracts, public records, and information gathered from correspondence with government bodies

● Search public records and online databases for property information, building permits, tax bills, and information related to clients and contracts

● Participate with executive Management Team on company growth strategy

● Prepare and present reports and to the Management Team

● Be a direct support to our Sales Team

● Be creative and have an analytical thinking mentality

● Work collaboratively with all departments to reach company targets

● Participate in regular training and success meetings




Qualifications:

● ● Bachelor’s degree or appropriate job-related experience

● Minimum of 2 years’ professional experience with a preference to those within the commercial real estate industry or experience with property assessments and/or real estate taxes (New college graduates with applicable Intern or co-op experience may be considered)

● Confident and comfortable speaking with others by phone/email

● Able to work independently as well as in a team environment

● Experience with research and data analysis

● Basic skills in Excel and Microsoft Office applications

● Strong organizational, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills

● Proven project management skills and experience handling concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy.

● Professional demeanor with a high degree of business acumen

● Creative, persistent, fast learner, and quick thinker - Problem Solver Mentality

● Must be able to handle rejection and overcome work obstacles




Compensation:

Commensurate with experience. Competitive Benefits Package including: 100% paid health insurance, dental, and vision coverage. Flexible Time Off and 401K contribution.

● Minimum of 2 years’ professional experience with a preference to those within the commercial real estate industry or experience with property assessments and/or real estate taxes (New college graduates with applicable Intern or co-op experience may be considered)

● Confident and comfortable speaking with others by phone/email

● Able to work independently as well as in a team environment

● Experience with research and data analysis

● Basic skills in Excel and Microsoft Office applications

● Strong organizational, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills

● Proven project management skills and experience handling concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy.

● Professional demeanor with a high degree of business acumen

● Creative, persistent, fast learner, and quick thinker - Problem Solver Mentality

Compensation:

Commensurate with experience. Competitive Benefits Package including: 100% paid health insurance, dental, and vision coverage. Flexible Time Off and 401K contribution.

Title: Data Analyst (Power BI, SQL)
Description:
Job Description:

Create and maintain Power BI reports and Dashboards upon gathering the requirements from various stakeholders.
Make changes to the existing Power BI Reports and Dashboards on a regular basis as per requests from Business.
Work in a Power BI environment to create dashboards like daily, weekly, monthly reports using Power BI desktop and publish them to server.
Create complex Stored Procedures, triggers, cursors, tables, views, SQL joins and statements for applications by using T-SQL.
Ensure data completeness, data quality by validating that all records, all fields and the full contents of each field are loaded.
Design Cubes with Star Schema using SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS). Created several Dashboards and Scorecards with Key Performance Indicators (KPI) in SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS).
Work on troubleshooting ADF pipeline issues when needed

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You’ll Be Doing:




Our Torq Insights practice is looking for superstars who will fill a key role by working with our clients to support all aspects of analytic initiatives from conception to completion. Your passion, knowledge and confidence will fuel a powerful experience that drives meaningful impact for our clients. Below are some of the key things you’ll need to excel in:




Build strong relationships with customer organization team members and cross-functional partners to provide strategic advice on data trends and requirements.
Be intellectually curious and have a passion for proactively digging into data
Develop KPIs and metrics within interactive visualizations that allow stakeholders to easily process and take action.
Simplify data into a compelling story that will be presented to stakeholders, including high-level executives and leaders.
Lead in all aspects of the BI lifecycle from gathering requirements to data validation, data analysis, report analysis, and understanding of business processes.
Account for the overall management of analytic projects; including timeliness, quality, and client value; QA/QC data and report outputs to ensure accuracy.
Promote data literacy and a self-serve culture across the enterprise through training & coaching business users on BI tools.




What You’ll Bring to the Table:




Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Business Information Management, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or related discipline
2 to 3 years of applied experience in Consulting, Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, or a related field
Ability to manage in an environment of ambiguity with diverse stakeholders
Strong quantitative, analytical, and conceptual problem-solving skills
Demonstrated ability to analyze data and develop visualizations that lead actionable insight
Experience with Power BI, Tableau, or other data visualization tools
Experience with SQL or other querying languages




Bonus Skills (not required but a plus!)




Web Analytics and Tagging platforms like Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics a plus
Python, R, SAS, or statistical analytics tools
Data Governance and Master Data Management standards and frameworks, specifically Informatica




Benefits And Other Fun Stuff




We ask our consultants to be superstars, so we treat them like it. Even better, our perks are designed for employees by our employees. We do this because we believe in delivering a compelling benefits package that puts you at the heart of our rewards.




Competitive Salary – your bank account will be smiling
Unlimited PTO – we’re serious about that work-life balance thing
Best-in-class health/vision/dental benefits – your health is our priority
Generous 401K options – take care of your future with us
Opportunity to be a key player at a highly reputable, fast-growing consulting firm
High degree of internal mobility and diverse project opportunities




Torq is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.




Note: No visa sponsorship is available for this position, all applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.

Our client is one of the leading automotive retailers in the United States. With over 300 locations and more than 10 million vehicles sold, they aim to transform the automotive industry through its innovation and bold leadership. They are looking to take on a SQL Data Analyst who will provide best practice recommendations related to SQL maintenance procedures. This is a hybrid position based in White Plains, NY.




SQL Data Analyst’s Responsibilities and Duties

Writing SQL scripts, queries, and stored procedures to extract data
Develops complex advancement reports using SQL, Microsoft Office and other utilities or languages as necessary
Performing ad hoc and structured data analysis
Generating quality reports
Identify data issues proactively and flag them to respective stakeholders

Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques

Excellent communication skills both written and verbal is a must with ability to convey complex information to key stakeholders

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*This is a 6 Month Contract-To-Hire role available to US Citizens and Green Card holders ONLY*




Overview

3+ years' experience as a data analyst or technical business analyst that is data savvy

Experience analyzing Direct to Consumer data

Experience creating use cases

Ability to create SQL queries from scratch to pull data from multiple sources

Familiar with any type of cloud (Snowflake preferred)




Nice to Have

Past experience working on Streaming Services

Experience creating dashboards in Tableau




Day-to-Day

Insight global is looking for a Technical Business Analyst to sit in LA for a large media company. This company is ramping up their direct-to-consumer organization and needs more help with various projects. This person will be joining the Business Intelligence and Engineering team for the company's DTC (direct-to-consumer) streaming platform. The Technical Business Analyst will work alongside Sr. Data Architects, Data Engineers and Reporting Analysts who will be doing the heavy lifting in the data. This analyst will need strong communication experience as they will be presenting weekly reports to stakeholders.




A day to day percentage breakdown is as followed:

* 90% pulling data using SQL queries made from scratch

* 10% gathering requirements from stakeholders (data engineering team and marketing team_

An example of a requirement this analyst may receive from the business is a Marketing or product revenue use case on creating a user graph. The Marketing team would request the analyst to run a campaign for all the users between 2 different systems (ex: user A exists in NBC and user 1 exists in Peacock) Marketing team wants to know if user A and user 1 are the same? The analyst would need to understand all the identifiers such as what shows they watch, where they are located, how long they're watching the show for, etc in order for them to pull the applicable data. Based on this analysis, the analyst will decide why users from Peacock are not users of NBC's platforms and vice versa. For example, a new advertising campaign from Peacock pulled users from Netflix or Hulu instead of an NBC platform.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Global Hires is looking for an ALL-STAR Data Analyst for our client in the packaging industry. Their mission is to collaboratively craft innovative, high-quality packaging solutions that balance the needs of their clients with the ever-evolving needs of their consumers. Caring for their business also means the internal teams are equally important - physical & mental health, integrity, team collaboration and sustainability!




The organization knows that data is the foundation to making smart decisions and requests an ALL-STAR Data Analyst to identify and communicate data-driven insights to maximize efficient operations and other initiatives. You will turn raw data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions.




The ideal team member should be passionate about finding insights in large datasets, synthesizing, and communicating results to drive business results and growth. You will work cross-functionally with Product Management, Engineering, Plant Quality, Sales, and Finance Departments. This position requires successful candidate to be a self-starter, managing and providing consistent and reliable reporting and analysis, in addition to utilizing primary and secondary research methods.




This role is an onsite, full-time position based out of the Modesto, CA office.




Job Functions & Core Responsibilities:

Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code patterns.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets.
Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources and maintain databases and data systems.
Provide analytical, statistical, and programming to identify key market trends focused on insights, user growth and content by performing market and competitive analyses.
Work with the management team to prioritize business data and information needs.
Monitor performance and quality controls plans to identify improvements.
Perform other tasks as assigned.




Skills:

Technical expertise regarding data models, databases design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of reporting packages (business objects etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (SML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks).
Strong knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analyzing datasets using visualization tools such as Python, R, Excel, and Tableau.
Extensive knowledge of programming language.
Strong data analytic skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of raw data into reports.
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
High attention to detail and accuracy.
Creative and critical thinking skills.
Strong problem-solving, presentation and graphical skills.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required.
Excellent organizational and project management skills.
Great interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.




Education/Experience & Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Information Technology, or related field required.
Master’s degree in Analytics or Data Science preferred.
3-5 years proven work experience as a data analyst or business data analyst.
Proven experience in data extraction, data cleaning, data loading, statistical data analysis, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling.
Experience using SPSS, SAS, Power BI, and Tableau.
